title: Project Coordinator

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Project Coordinator (Construction)
Maintaining, preparing (with the guidance of the PM) and monitoring project plans, schedules, work hours, budgets and expenditure

Organizing, attending and participating in stakeholder meetings with documentation and follow up of important actions and decisions from meetings

Preparing necessary presentation materials for meetings
Ensuring project deadlines are met
Determining Project Changes
Familiarize and ensure that the projects adhere to the required specifications and framework, and that all documentation and submissions are prepared and maintained appropriately and accordingly for each submission

Access project risks and issues and provide solutions where applicable

To work and prepare the necessary documents for the monthly progress claims with the administrator and contracts department
Ensure quality controls of project output
Any other adhoc jobs assigned

Requirements:
Excellent skills with Microsoft Word, Office, Excel, Powerpoint, Outlook, etc
Ability to pay attention to detail
Good communication skills
Ability to overcome challenges
Ability to manage time effectively

title: CUSTOMER SERVICE COORDINATOR
company_info: No information added.
job_category: Admin / Secretarial, Customer Service, General Work
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Construction Customer Service Coordinator is responsible for overseeing customer service operations specific to construction projects. This role involves acting as a liaison between clients, project managers, and field teams to address inquiries, resolve issues, and maintain high client satisfaction throughout the construction process.
1. Client Communication: Serve as the main point of contact for client inquiries, requests, and concerns related to construction projects.

2. Project Coordination: Work closely with project managers and field teams to ensure that project timelines, deliverables, and client expectations are met.

3. Issue Resolution: Address and resolve client complaints, construction-related issues, and change requests promptly, escalating complex problems to the appropriate teams when necessary.

4. Progress Updates: Provide clients with regular updates on project progress, milestones achieved, and any potential delays.

5. Client Feedback: Collect and relay client feedback, suggestions, and concerns to project managers and construction teams for continuous improvement.

company_info: CHANG HUA CONSTRUCTION PTE LTD Chang Hua Construction Pte Ltd was founded in 1995. The Company is a registered contractor with the Building and Construction Authority CW01-A1. Chang Hua Construction is a major contractor of Architectural and Structural Engineering works. It's vast portfolio includes various kinds of building works such as private houses, government housings, factories, hotels, dormitories, offices, show flats, and private high-rise condominium, etc. The total contract value of more than S$600 million Singapore dollars had been awarded to the company in the previous years. Chang Hua's team of professionals, skilled and unskilled workers totaling more than 400 were recruited and selected internationally by our key personnel. They are managed under our direct management team, with our structured re-training and direct assignment of work packages in Singapore, which had resulted to a superior labor force in project bidding. The company's direct management team ensures a consistently high standard of workmanship and ensures timely delivery of projects. Delivering and completing the assignments within schedule had been a prime consideration and important factor by our regular clients. Chang Hua is able to procure, import and install a special material that meets the particular requirement of unique and special designed projects thus increasing our competitiveness in project bidding. Chang Hua aims and is well prepared to go regional and is taking an important step forward in expanding major business division to foreign countries with potential business growth opportunities such as China, Abu Dhabi, etc. The company seeks to consistently achieve perfect workmanship. This acts as a guarantee of our confidence which will benefit our pool of existing and potential clients. Chang Hua's motto "RESPONSIBILITY IS OUR KEY" sums our full commitment to every project we undertake.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Project Performance Specialist (Project Controller/ FP&A/ Accounts)

12-Month Contract
Industry : Pharmaceutical
Location: Gul Cirlce
Salary up to $6000 depending on experience

Job Summary:
Responsible for the delivery of Operational and Financial sustainable results across the Scientific Affairs organization.
Ensure that all project expenses are properly accounted for, that all purchase orders align with project budgets and timelines, and that all necessary steps are taken to manage projects effectively.

Responsibilities
Key Results:
Accurate tracking and reporting of project budgets, including regular updates on budget vs. actual spend
Timely and efficient processing of purchase orders, ensuring that all necessary approvals are obtained and that all purchases are made in accordance with project budgets and timelines
Effective communication of purchase order information to project stakeholders, including regular updates on the status of purchase orders and any relevant budget or timeline changes
Effective project management, including delivery of projects on time, within budget, and to the desired quality standards

Accountabilities:
Monitor project budgets and provide regular updates to project managers and stakeholders
Manage the purchase order process, including creating and submitting purchase orders for approval, tracking the status of orders, and ensuring timely receipt of goods and services
Communicate basic purchase order information to project stakeholders, including order status, delivery dates, and any relevant budget or timeline changes
Provide project management oversight, including ensuring that projects are delivered on time, within budget, and to the desired quality standards
Ensure that all purchase orders are in compliance with project budgets and timelines
Collaborate with project managers and stakeholders to resolve any budget, purchase order, or project management issues that arise
Maintain accurate records of all purchase orders, project budget information, and project management information.

Requirements:
Extensive technical knowledge of MS tools, especially Excel and Power-point. Knowledge of Power BI and share-point are ideal
Demonstrated good project coordination and data analysis skills based on information reported from a broad variety of sources
Excellent influencing, negotiation skill to build consensus and drive resolution of issues while maintaining positive working relationships across functions


If you possess above relevant skillsets, please send in your updated CV in word format to Apple.lim@manpower.com.sg

title: Project Coordinator (Fabrication and Project)
company_info: We believe our success is through the efforts of our people. We welcome high energy individuals with the right skills and mindset to join our team! Founded in 1995, the Prime Structures Group is a Singapore-managed group of companies providing building envelope solutions. Prime Structures has presence in Brunei, Hong Kong, Indonesia, Philippines and Sri Lanka. We take an integrated approach to provide design, build, and supply solutions across Asia. We pride ourselves on our ability to manage the challenges and complexities of providing complete building envelope solutions. Our integrated approach lets us take ownership of our clients' building envelope. Our ﬂexibility and experience enable us to anticipate challenges in the process, ﬁnd innovative ways to solve problems and build buy-in from everyone along the way. With our commitment to delivering the building envelope solution that meets our clients' goals, we give all a peace of mind. We are in the business of Façade Design & Management where we focus on 4 main businesses offerings: 1. BUILDING ENVELOPES We’ve developed innovative building envelopes that help to improve overall building design and maximize light and heat efficiency. As a certified Building Construction Authority of Singapore (BCA) CR16 L6 curtain wall contractor, we’re able to tender for curtain wall projects of unlimited amounts. 2. CUSTOMISED STRUCTURES AND ART STRUCTURES We have the engineering expertise to construct and install customised structures and art structures. The ‘Momentum’ by David Gerstein, and the ‘Wind Arbor’ art wall are two of our completed projects situated in prominent locations in Singapore. 3. SECURITY FACADES We’ve developed security facades that resolve environmental, structural and security threats in order to achieve secure buildings that are both aesthetically appealing and functional. 4. INTERIOR FIT-OUTS We deliver end-to-end restoration, renovation and interior fit-out solutions on time while maintaining the highest standards of safety and quality.
address: SINDO INDUSTRIAL ESTATE, 430 TAGORE INDUSTRIAL AVENUE 787810
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Project Coordinator supports two functions:
1) Fabrication
Assist in the production of fabricated materials for projects and ensure they are done on time, efficiently, safely and to specfications.

2) Project
Assist in the planning, execution and monitoring of the project to be completed on time, within budget, safely and to specfications.
Responsibilities:

Planning, Execution and Monitoring (Project)
Conduct research and analysis regarding the project's requirement
Assist in the overall quality control of the work (budget, schedule, plans, personnel’s performance) and report regularly on project status
Monitor the work progress on daily basis
Assist to prepare internal and external reports pertaining to project status
Evaluate project progress and prepare detailed reports
Collaborate with design team and engineers regarding the design and cutting lists and shop drawings
Ensure quality construction standards and the use of proper construction techniques
Assist to obtain required permits and licences
Ensure compliance to applicable codes, practices, QA/QC policies, performance standards and specifications
Contract Management (Project)
Evaluate progress and prepare detailed reports
Timely submission of progress claims to the client/main-contractor
Supplier and Sub-Contractor Management (Project)
Coordinate and direct construction workers and subcontractors
Planning, Execution and Monitoring (Fabrication)
Coordinate and collaborate where necessary with procurement and project teams to ensure timely fabrication of materials to be delivered for the projects.
Quality Control and Compliance (Fabrication)
Assist the fabrication and production processes, ensuring quality control and compliance with industry standards and specifications.
Ensure factory production and processes are in compliance with related legal/statutory regulations and as per contract specifications
Implement quality control standard operating procedures and ensure factory employees work to established standards
Propose and implement machine standard operating procedures and ensure factory equipment are running at optimal efficiency
Safety
Ensure adherence to all health and safety standards and report issues
Ensure ongoing works are in compliance with building and safety regulations and report incidents (if any)
Requirements:

Diploma in construction management, architecture, civil engineering or related field
Working experience in building and construction / civil and structural projects
Advanced knowledge of construction management processes, means and methods
Working knowledge of building products, construction details and relevant rules, regulations and quality standards
Understanding of all aspects of the construction process
Working knowledge of softwares: Microsoft Office, Project, BIM, Autocad, Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP)
Competent in conflict and crisis management
Excellent time and project management skills
Excellent communication skills (Oral and Written). English proficiency is a must.

title: Coordinator, Project
company_info: Molex Incorporated is one of the world’s largest manufacturers of electronic connectors. Today, we employ over 46,000 people worldwide. Our core business is the manufacture and sale of electronic components. Our products are used by a large number of leading original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) throughout the world. We design, manufacture and sell more than 100,000 products. We also provide manufacturing services to integrate specific components into a customer’s product. Our engineering, development and manufacturing capabilities are organized into four product divisions, all serviced by the Molex Global Sales and Marketing division. Molex brings together innovation and technology to deliver electronic solutions to customers worldwide. Molex offers a full suite of solutions and services for many markets, including data communications, consumer electronics, medical, industrial, automotive, and commercial vehicle. For more information, please visit www.molex.com Molex is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in hiring or employment on the basis of color, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, ethnicity, age, disability, pregnancy, veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, military status, medical status, marital status, gender identity and expression, protected genetic information or other legally protected factors. Molex Singapore will not refuse to hire a disabled applicant who can perform the essential functions of the job with reasonable accommodation.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Your Job
Be part of a global cross functional team that help to develop exciting products for the EV industries, globally. Support project managers in realizing new product development projects from concept to commercialization.

Our Team
Independent, fun and passionate group of people who enjoy working with people from different regions; putting differences aside with one common goal.
You will be reporting to Group Manager, Project.

What You Will Do
· Plan and manage team goals, project schedules and new information.
· Supervise current projects and coordinate all team members to keep workflow on track
· Manage project-related paperwork by ensuring all necessary materials are current, properly filed and stored
· Communicate with stakeholders to identify and define project requirements, scope and objectives
· Identify / Escalate project risks and develop solutions where necessary
· Organize / Participate in project meetings and propose improvements if necessary
· Ensuring projects adhere to frameworks and all records/evidence maintained.
· Develop and Track detail Action plans
· Identify change requests and manage records.
· Providing administrative support as needed.
· Other duties as assigned by Management

Who You Are (Basic Qualifications)
· Diploma or Higher in Engineering / Management or equivalent field
· 2 – 3 years in Engineering , Manufacturing or equivalent working with global distributed networks
· Exceptional verbal, written, and presentation skills
· Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team
· Strong organizational and multi-tasking skills
· Excellent analytical and problem solving abilities
· Documentation management and ability to use project management tools
· Time management skills with the ability to meet deadlines
· Office 365 Competency (eg. Sharepoint / Teams etc)

What Will Put You Ahead
· Project Management Certification would be advantage
· Electronics / Automotive background
· Working knowledge of Microsoft Project / IATF61949 / ISO9001

At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. The actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. If you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy.

Who We Are
As a Koch company, Molex is a leading supplier of connectors and interconnect components, driving innovation in electronics and supporting industries from automotive to health care and consumer to data communications. The thousands of innovators who work for Molex have made us a global electronics leader. Our experienced people, groundbreaking products and leading-edge technologies help us deliver a wider array of solutions to more markets than ever before.

At Koch, employees are empowered to do what they do best to make life better. Learn how our business philosophy helps employees unleash their potential while creating value for themselves and the company.

title: Project Manager
company_info: ISO-Integrated M&E Pte Ltd (IME) is formed after ISOTeam Corporation Pte. Ltd. acquired Rong Shun Engineering & Construction Pte Ltd (RSE) in December 2016. The acquisition allows ISOTeam to expand into other M&E business on top of the traditional projects under RSE which has BCA workhead of L5 for electrical works and L1 for other mechanical services. With new and strong parentage, IME has started venturing into solar photovoltaic system installation and energy saving initiatives. IME has an excellent project track record with public sector and government agencies such as National Environment Agency (NEA), Housing & Development Board (HDB), Ministry of Defence (MOD), Ministry of Education (MOE), National Parks Board (NPB) and various town councils. Recurring projects from business partners and clients are largely due to its reputation of consistency in quality workmanship and on time delivery track record which has been made possible with our team of strong professional management and site staffs.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Statement Of Purpose (Overall Purpose of Job)
In charge of the execution of all electrical works inclusive of planning, scheduling, controlling, coordination and ensure works carried out are in accordance to approved shop drawings / specification and complete within the completion date. In addition, budget control and contract administration.
Major Duties & Responsibilities
(A) Specific:
Contract administrative inclusive of budget control and cost improvements.
Evaluate costing received for electrical works.
Vet through shop drawings to ensure all are in compliance to technical specifications / authority requirements prior to submission.
Liaise and have meetings with Clients and Consultants on technical resolution / clarification, inspection and submission.
To be the lead contact point for all Electrical issues.
To attend weekly site meeting.
To build and maintain strong, long-lasting client relationship and meet Client’s expectations.
To manage, coordinate, work and oversee managers, engineers, all workers, sub-contractors and vendors to ensure proper work execution and good workmanship.
To plan, implement, track the work progress and submit weekly progress report so as to ensure that the project executed is on time and within budget.
To monitor project cost including variation works and submission of supporting documents.
(B) General :
Prepare and submit progress reports.
Maintain proper documentation for all projects.
Coordinate and work with other departments.
Engage, coordinate and oversee all project works to ensure successful completion and handing over to Clients.
Other duties as assigned.
(C) Safety:
To follow the safety procedures, rules and regulations and eliminate or reduce hazard at the work place.
Job Requirements
(A) Education, Qualifications & Special Training :
Diploma or Degree in Electrical Engineering.
(B) Knowledge & Skills :
Well-versed with installation of M&E services and builder’s works.
Good interpersonal skills.
Independent & Team player.
Proactive and able to take initiative.
Good in negotiation.
Good communication skills (verbal and written).
PC literate and knowledge in MS Office.
(C) Experience :
Minimum 10 years of relevant experience with 3 years of managerial experience.

Supervise and oversee the sequential activities of Structural, Piping & Mechanical Equipment (SMP) Installation such as Receiving, Locating in the lay down, Preservation,Foundation and Structure, Receiving from Main Contractor/Suppliers/Vendors,Pipe Support Installation, Launching, Fitting and Welding of piping, Flange Alignment, Punch Clearing, Reinstatement,Touch up Painting and Hand Over.
Must have working knowledge of all applicable piping and structure standards and recommended practices, e.g. BS, ASME,ASTM,CSA,API etc.
Managing project scope and change control with commercial or without commercial impact.
Development of procedures, flowchart or process flow, detailed calculation based on available Engineering information.
To procure and requisition materials based on interpret construction and technical drawings.
Communicate with Engineering/technical/quality requirement to team individuals.
Project Coordinate with Clients, PMD, Procurement, Engineering, Contract & Finance Departments & Subcontractors and interfaces with other REL' s Business Units.
Working closely with main contractor and client to ensure the project meets the required needs.
Resolve any unexpected technical difficulties for SMP scope and other problems that may arise at any time.
Oversee the Steel Structural Works, Piping and Mechanical while assist and communicate for any prioritise from Pre-Fabrication required (e.g PTREI and Subcontractors)
Preparation of method of statement, risk assessments for Piping, Mechanical & Steel Structure Scopes.
Monitoring and installation supervision with Subordinates to deliver the projects in Safety, Quality and Production manners.
To liaise with clients representative on all project issues and subcontractors to ensure safe and efficient delivery of projects to both the company and clients satisfaction.
Leading the supervisors and foremen in finding and executing solutions to SMP related problems on site.
Communicating with Project Management Team / QAQC Team to validate and document all changes and highlight to PM for changes that shall involve additional works.
Assist with the management of internal and external third party interfaces.
Requirements
Diploma or Degree in Electrical and Instrumentation
Min 3 to 5 years work experience as Electrical Project Engineer in Oil and Petrochemical Construction Industry
Experience in project co-ordination with client, engineering and procurement departments
Experience in co-ordinating with site construction team for installation, testing and commissioning works
Preferably with overseas experience
*FRESH GRADUATES ENCOURAGE TO APPLY*

title: Project Coordinator (Metocean)
company_info: Fugro is the world’s leading Geo-data specialist, collecting and analysing comprehensive information about the Earth and the structures built upon it. Adopting an integrated approach that incorporates acquisition and analysis of Geo-data and related advice, Fugro provides solutions. With expertise in site characterisation and asset integrity, clients are supported in the safe, sustainable and efficient design, construction and operation of their assets throughout the full lifecycle. Employing approximately 9,500 talented people in 61 countries, Fugro serves clients around the globe, predominantly in the energy and infrastructure industries, both offshore and onshore. In 2019, revenue amounted to EUR 1.6 billion. The company is listed on Euronext Amsterdam.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Project Coordinator (PC) is a member of the Marine Metocean Surveys Service Line and is involved in projects in the Asia Pacific Region.

The PC will work together with the Project Managers and is responsible for:
- Compliance with Fugro’s and client’s Document Control procedures and keeping the Master Document Registers up to date.
- Setting up and amending Project schedules for the Project Managers.
- Preparation of Project Documentation, like Project Execution Plans, any required bridging documents, which need to comply with the Fugro Document Standard (FDS).
- Data input and verification of correct information in our Fugro Enterprise Resource Planning software, IFS, and, if required, coordinating with procurement in projects.
- Minute of Meetings and/or Action Tracker preparation.

The PC provides a supporting role to projects through the coordination of project related activities, such as logistics, resourcing, training, progress updates, project tracking, preparation of meeting minutes amongst others.
The PC works in accordance with the Fugro Project Management Handbook, ensuring that the agreed work is carried out efficiently.

The goal is to grow in a role of becoming a Junior Project Manager and later as a Project Manager.
PS: To become more familiar with the industry we are working in, the PC could go to site on a project.

Essential Requirements:
Previous experience in project administration for / related to the oil & gas and/or marine survey industry; knowledgeable administering projects / operation in multiple regions / countries preferred
Strong communication skills with excellent command of written and spoken English; preference given if capable to communicate in other Asian / local languages
Some previous experience in resource planning; financial planning, tracking and control; documentation development and tracking
Team player with leadership skills;
Planning and analytical skills with experience in relevant techniques and software application, strong problem-solving skills
High focus on project quality and HSE performance, experience in risk assessment techniques and exercise

Desirable Experience:
Degree (or equivalent) in project or business management
Experience working with multinational company
Minimum 3 years working experience in relevant field, in marine survey and/or energy industry

Ensure everyone on site comply with safety regulations and maintain a safe working environment.
Collaborate with architects, engineers, consultants, owners and all relevant parties and authorities to ensure project runs smoothly and objectives are met.
Conduct regular site inspections and quality checks to ensure workmanship meets company standards.
Daily briefing /reminders to workers and sub-contractors either the evening before or in the morning before work start on the work to be done and the progress that needs to be met for the day.
Assists in purchasing materials and tools at times and help fetch workers from site to site when necessary
Prepare progress reports and communicate daily work progress updates to the Director.
Requirements:
Minimum 2-5 years of relevant full-time working experience in construction and/or renovation project supervision in Singapore.
Required to possess a BCSS/CSOC certificate.
Required to possess a construction-related diploma recognized by BCA/PEB.
Required to possess a BCCPE certificate.
Required to possess a Class 3 driving license, small lorry provided to travel to site
Added advantage if you possess a bizSAFE Level 2 (Risk Management Course) certificate.
Experienced in small scale projects, A&A and renovation work for residential, industrial, commercial and factories (experience in HIP an added advantage).

title: Project Coordinator
company_info: Elevandi is set up by the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) to foster an open dialogue between the public and private sectors to advance FinTech in the digital economy. We work closely with governments, founders, investors, and corporate leaders to drive collaboration, education, and new sources of value at the industry and national levels. Our initiatives have convened over 300,000 people since 2016 to drive the growth of FinTech through events, closed-door roundtables, investor programmes, educational initiatives, and research. ​​Our flagship product is the Singapore FinTech Festival alongside fast-rising platforms, including the World FinTech Festival and Point Zero Forum.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Project Coordinator
(Full time from now until 30 Nov 2023)
Are you ready to dive into the world of FinTech and rub shoulders with leaders like Vitalik Buterin, Indian PM Narendra Modi, Anthony Tan, and Former New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern?
We’re Elevandi,
And we’re the organisers of the world’s most impactful FinTech events;
Conveners of the global FinTech community;
And champions for the adoption and vibrant growth of FinTech globally.
The Singapore FinTech Festival, World FinTech Festival, Point Zero Forum — since our founding by the Monetary Authority of Singapore in 2021, we’ve hosted more than 350,000 participants from the public and private sectors at our global events. Together with policymakers, founders, investors, and corporate leaders, we're pushing the boundaries of collaboration, education, and value creation at the industry and national levels.
Elevandi is seeking highly motivated and detail-oriented Project Coordinators to join our team. Project Coordinators will be exposed to the inner workings of the world's largest FinTech event, the Singapore FinTech Festival. The Project Coordinators will be assisting the Speaker Management team in liaising with event speakers, and to ensure that the event is delivered to the highest standards. The ideal candidate must have excellent organisational, communication, and interpersonal skills, as well as a sharp eye for detail.
Job Description
· Ensure that the speakers' information is up-to-date and accurate
· Liaise with speakers to manage their onboarding, travel and accommodation arrangements
· Answer email queries from speakers promptly in a professional manner
· Liaise with the working team to ensure that all speakers' requirements are provisioned for
Project Coordinators Stand to Gain
· Learn and hone communication, critical thinking & project management skills
· Exposure to working with international senior-level personnel (c-suite and government)
· Experience a fast-paced and dynamic work environment
· Insight into the FinTech industry and behind the scenes of the Singapore FinTech Festival
Job Qualifications and Skill Sets
* Excellent organisational and time management skills
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines
* A keen eye for detail
* Fluency in written and spoken English
* Knowledge of the fintech industry is a plus
Apply now
Send your profile and if there’s a fit we will be in touch. As we receive a lot of interest it’s not always possible to reply to everyone. If you don’t hear from us within 30 days we wish you all the best in your search.
We are currently prioritising candidates able to work in Singapore without the need for sponsorship of an employment visa.

title: Roller Shutters Door Project Coordinator
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
A project coordinator in a roller shutter doors company is responsible for overseeing and coordinating various aspects of projects related to the installation, maintenance, and repair of roller shutter doors. They work closely with different teams, including sales, engineering, and installation, to ensure projects are completed on time, within budget, and according to the client's specifications. The project coordinator's duties may include:
1. Planning and scheduling project activities, milestones, and deadlines.
2. Coordinating with clients to understand their requirements and expectations.
3. Collaborating with the sales team to prepare project proposals and estimates.
4. Assisting in the procurement of materials and equipment necessary for the projects.
5. Allocating resources and manpower effectively to ensure smooth project execution.
6. Monitoring project progress, identifying potential issues, and implementing corrective actions.
7. Conducting regular project meetings and providing updates to stakeholders.
8. Ensuring compliance with safety regulations and quality standards.
9. Managing project documentation, including contracts, permits, and technical specifications.
10. Conducting project evaluations and generating reports on project performance.
Qualifications and Skills:
• Candidates with a background in engineering, construction management, or related fields are preferred. A minimum of secondary school level or a high school diploma is required.
• Proven experience in project coordination or management, preferably in the construction industry or a similar field.
• Excellent organizational and time management skills, supported by relevant qualifications.
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with different teams and stakeholders.
• Proficiency in project management software and tools.
• Attention to detail and ability to multitask.
• Knowledge of roller shutter doors or related products is a plus.
• Min. class 3 Licence. Vehicle provided by Company.
Please note that specific requirements and responsibilities may vary depending on the company and its projects. It is advisable to carefully review the job description provided by the roller shutter doors company you are interested in to align with their specific needs and qualifications.

Job Summary:
We are non-profit NGO/charity with operations in Cambodia and Nepal. The Volunteer /Projects Coordinator will liaise and facilitate with volunteers who are interested in going to these countries for community or service-learning projects. Project Coordinator will assist in starting Livelihood projects.

Job Descriptions:

A) Working with Teams:
Work out quotation and itinerary for teams volunteering to go to Cambodia to build houses, wells, toilets and other activities such as interaction with children at our children home.
Lead teams to Cambodia and ensure the staff have organized the program properly such as material are purchased, beneficiaries selected, accommodation and meals properly catered for.
Coordinate with staff to ensure the above are carried out before the team arrives.
When in Cambodia, ensure that volunteers are assigned tasks to do and all tools, equipment and materials are available.
Work out the budget to be transferred to Cambodia before team arrives.
Ensure staff follows SOPs in executing the projects.
Promote and market these volunteer opportunities/programs to schools, tertiary institutions, companies, and churches.
B) Working on Projects
Assist in starting new income generating projects.
Handle startup projects and solves obstacles
Do research and acquire skills and knowledge to execute the project.
Able to work with staff, to guide and supervise them.
Able to adapt to local culture and work with the locals.

Job Requirements:
Willing to travel to Cambodia or Nepal and stay up to 4 weeks if needed per trip (may need to travel once a month or more)
Diploma, Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma, Bachelor's Degree

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:

• A successful track record of supporting complex customer projects within a fast-paced ICT or Telecommunications industry;
• Manage implementation of IT infrastructure project

• Assist to be the main point of contact to coordinate project management activities, resources, equipment and information with clients’ project manager and internal technical team
• Provides weekly project updates including action item updates.
• Schedules and coordinates project reviews and follows up on assigned actions.
• Effectively and accurately communicate status to the project team.
• Assist with maintaining and monitoring project plans, project schedules, work hours and expenditures.
• Assists with identifying project issues, determining the right team member to provide a solution, and/or escalating the issue to the client manager.
• Takes part in organizing, attending and participating in stakeholder meetings.
• Documents and follows up on important actions and decisions from meetings.
• Collaborates with various regional teams responsible for project resources and ticket resolution.
• Assists with daily monitoring of the ticketing system, reassigning tickets where required.
• Produces regular reports as required.
• stablished team player with the ability to build strong relationships with customers, vendors and internal stakeholders;
• A self-starter with a determination to succeed, balanced with appropriate tact and diplomacy; and
• Other duties as required. This list is not meant to be a comprehensive inventory of all responsibilities assigned to this position
• Knowledge of logistic in inbound/outbound movement, coordination and tracking.
• Carry out tasks related to receiving inbound shipments and packing outbound shipments.
• Organize Delivery Orders from suppliers and cross-check them against purchase orders.
• Manage and coordinate all courier and freight services.
• Assist with RMA requests and processing.

Required Qualifications/Skills:

• Associate's degree (A.A) or equivalent from two-year college or technical school and 0 to 2 years’ related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience
• Flexibility essential - the role requires both office and remote commitments, as well as being willing to occasionally adjust work hours due to work with regional colleagues.
• Familiarity with Microsoft Excel and Google Suite
• Excellent Communication skills, both verbal and written
• Proactive attitude and dependable
• Excellent customer service skills
• Ability to work both within a team and independently
• Ability to multitask and prioritize workload
• Ability to use good judgment, as well as problem-solving and decision making skills
• Ability to maintain confidentiality and professional decorum

title: Project Coordinator / Site Supervisor
company_info: SUNSCREEN (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD. was established in 1981 to more efficiently meet the growing demand for rollscreens in today's context in a simple and attractive way. Rollite™ Rollscreens effectively shields out the sun, providing interiors with cool, shaded relief from exterior heat, whilst maintaining visual connectivity and airflow with the external environment. The idea of using fiberglass screens as an internal shading system was timely and ideal, as the 1980s saw a rising prevalence of high-rise buildings clad in glass curtain walls. To complement modern architectural language, the fiberglass screen was further improved by being integrated with a compact and reliable internal roller assembly, which allows the length of the fabric to be stored within a minimal space, out of sight. Thereafter, it was registered under the trademark of Rollite™ Rollscreens in Singapore and overseas by Sunscreen Singapore, the exclusive manufacturer of Rollite™ Rollscreensand Skylight Shading Systems. Sunscreen Singapore was certified with ISO 9001:2000 by BSI Management Systems. In October 2009, Sunscreen Singapore has successfully transited to ISO 9001:2008.

title: NCS Grants Senior Coordinator
company_info: Conservation International (CI) helps societies sustainably care for nature, our global biodiversity, for the benefit of humanity. An abundance of clean fresh water is critical for people and nature to thrive yet more people have cell phones than have access to safe drinking water. Healthy freshwater systems provide water for human consumption, sanitation, agriculture, industrial manufacturing, and energy generation, underpinning economic development.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
SUMMARY
Conservation International protects nature for the benefit of humanity. Through science, policy, fieldwork, and
finance, we spotlight and secure the most important places in nature for the climate, biodiversity, and for
people. With offices in 30 countries and projects in more than 100 countries, Conservation International
partners with governments, companies, civil society, Indigenous peoples, and local communities to help
people and nature thrive together.

CI is one of the global leaders in using natural climate solutions (NCS) to combat climate change. There is
significant growth in the demand for high-quality conservation projects that can access the voluntary and
compliance carbon markets and CI is rapidly expanding their portfolio of high-quality carbon projects and
technical assistance to carbon policy initiatives to meet this demand. CI Asia Pacific (CIAP) has recently
launched the Asia Pacific Technical Assistance Facility (TAF), a multi-donor facility, to provide technical
support and invest in NCS projects and enabling conditions. Projects include REDD+, landscape restoration
and management, and blue carbon mechanisms.

Based out of the Asia Pacific Field Division (APFD), CI is seeking a Senior Coordinator to provide technical
support to the APFD NCS team by managing sub-grants from the AP TAF to CI country teams and external
partners. This involves overseeing the grant application and management process within the TAF, and the
efficient and effective distribution of grants to projects that align with our conservation mission.

The senior coordinator will be responsible for ensuring an efficient distribution of grants and tracking the
expenditure of the grant towards deliverables outlined in the grant agreement. He/she will also be responsible
for maintaining a record of projects that have received TAF funding and provide support in monitoring the
performance and impact of NCS projects that receive TAF funding for internal and external reporting purposes.

As a member of the APFD NCS team, the Senior Coordinator will work closely with the Pipeline management
team on overseeing the project pipeline of NCS leads and opportunities and provide administrative assistance
to facilitate the tracking of leads. Additionally, the Senior Coordinator will support the Pipeline management
team in reporting to APFD Senior Leadership.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Support the APFD NCS team to administer and manage grants provided by the TAF to CI country programs and external partners, ensuring proper documentation throughout the process.
Work closely with Operations teams, to ensure that processes and documentation are in compliance with CI policies and regulatory requirements.
Ensure compliance with signed grant agreement and monitor project progress towards timelines, deliverables, and funding terms.
Assist in financial tracking and monitoring the performance and impact of NCS project that are allocated TAF funding, helping to ensure data collection and evaluation are carried out effectively.
Contribute to periodic reporting and presentation materials on the progress and outcomes of NCS projects to TAF donors, APFD leadership, other CI departments that the team works closely with external stakeholders, highlighting key impact metrics, outcomes, challenges and opportunities for improvement. Assist in note-taking for meetings related to NCS TAF.
Support the NCS Project Analyst with the origination pipeline of new NCS project opportunities, keeping track of project status and steps necessary to continue engagement and develop project documentation. Attend regular project origination meetings.
Assist in identifying potential projects and partnerships that align with CI's conservation objectives and NCS TAF criteria for grant disbursement.
Provide administrative support to the APFD NCS team, including scheduling meetings with NCS leads and project partners, preparing agendas, and maintaining documentation.
In alignment with priority policy initiatives of the APFD NCS team, provide coordination support between the team and the APFD policy team.
ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Support the management APFD NCS project database, to track and monitor new NCS project leads and opportunities.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of grant applications, contracts and grant-related documentation.
PEOPLE AND RESOURCE MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITIES
This position will require managing and monitoring of budgets.
This position does not directly manage staff, but requires coordination with the work of CI country program staff and partners.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s Degree in Environmental Science, Geography, Natural Resource Management, Finance or a related field.
Proven experience of 2 to 4 years in project coordination, grant management, or a related field.
Familiarity with financial and legal aspects of grant management, including budgeting and compliance.
Prior experience working in a non-government organization, conservation organizations or carbon-related projects is a plus.
Excellent practical knowledge with NCS concepts and their relevance in climate change mitigation efforts.
Proficient with project management tools and Mircrosoft Office Suite. Skilled at adapting to new project information management applications.
Excellent analytical and quantification skills.
Effective communications skills and experience collaborating with internal and external stakeholders.
Highly organized and strong attention to detail.
Collaborative mindset with the ability to work independently with little supervision and as part of a multidisciplinary team.
Able to work well under pressure, quickly understand project parameters and capable of meeting deadlines on time.
ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS
Experience working across different countries in the Asia Pacific region.
Good interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
Professional interest in working with NGOs dedicated to conservation and NCS.
WORKING CONDITIONS
The position would be based in Singapore.
This is a full-time position with the flexibility to adjust to deadlines and time zones.
Flexibility in work schedule is required in order to accommodate time differences between field offices in Asia Pacific in multiple time zones.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Descriptions:
Lead and manage the overall planning, execution, and delivery of Web3 GameFi projects, ensuring they are completed within scope, budget, and timeline.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define project objectives, requirements, and success criteria.
Develop comprehensive project plans, including tasks, milestones, resource allocation, and dependencies, and effectively communicate them to the project team.
Coordinate and prioritise tasks across cross-functional teams, ensuring efficient workflow and effective communication.
Monitor project progress, identify risks, and implement mitigation strategies to address any issues that may arise.
Foster a collaborative and positive team environment, promoting open communication, knowledge sharing, and continuous improvement.
Manage project budgets, track expenses, and ensure adherence to financial targets.
Collaborate closely with game designers, developers, and blockchain engineers to ensure the successful integration of Web3 and DeFi concepts into GameFi projects.

Proven experience as a Project Manager, preferably in the gaming industry or Web3/GameFi projects.
Strong understanding of Web3 technologies, blockchain, and decentralised finance (DeFi) concepts.
Experience managing end-to-end game development projects, including planning, execution, and delivery.
Familiarity with game development processes, including game design, programming, and art production.
Excellent organisational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritise tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire cross- functional teams.
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with diverse stakeholders.
Proactive problem-solving and risk management abilities, with a focus on delivering high-quality projects on time and within budget.
Familiarity with project management tools and methodologies, such as Agile or Scrum.

We also have the capability to meet all urgent requests and constantly achieved half the industry average lead/production time, which is made possible because of our extensive and dynamic relationships with at least 150 manufacturers for any of our product. Therefore in Illuminating Asia, we strive to provide end-to-end LED lighting solutions, giving our customers a hassle free LED lighting experience.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Here is a exciting, fulfilling engineering career that cuts across M&E engineering, design, architecture, arts, creative media, electronics engineering, Technology, Smart IoT, big data analytics, and more. Selected candidates for our management associate program will be trained towards becoming the future leadership cadre of the company.

You will work on exciting and challenging topics/projects together with a team or independantly in an ultra-modern, innovative and creative environment to impact lives. Gradually becoming the best of the best in the engineering industry, training up to be a respected lighting consultant.

Lighting designs + engineering + technology + a lighting designer’s worth + future career development = We have figured it all out.

If you are passionate about new technologies and new ideas, IASPL could be a place for you!

Training, mentorship, and personal development programs will be incorporated within daily operations and on the job.

Beyond mind-blowing experiences and a strong career development path, let's create a meaningful future for people with our skills!
Prerequisite:
Graduate from a reputable university/polytechnic in mechanical and electrical electronic engineering schools (Singapore NTU, NUS, SUTD, SIT, SST, Singapore Poly, Ngee Ann Poly, Temasek Poly, Nanyang Poly, Republic Poly, Raffles College of Design, SOTA, Laselle, etc.).
Curious and likes technology and its applications.
At least having basic knowledge in Arduino and relevant programming.
PC literate and proficient in MS Office and well versed in relevant software such as Autocad, Sketchup, Revit, Photoshop, Dialux Evo/ Dialux, Computer Graphics Rendering (lighting and building 3D models).
Working towards or already possesing relevant licenses, qualified professional accreditations (LEW, PE) will be a strong plus point.
Having taken part in a competition is an added advantage to your application.
The character should possess honesty, integrity, working hard and right, confidence.
Able to handle both physical aspects of running around sites daily and indoor desk bound work (i.e research and reporting, etc).
Previous sales experience in the Lighting Industry would be a bonus.
Capable of managing multiple projects at any one time without supervision.
Ability to communicate design ideas effectively, responsible, highly organized, flexible, and a supportive team player.
Reliable, self-motivated, focused, positive attitude, proactive and solution-oriented problem solver, able to adapt to changes in priorities, structures, tasks, and goals.
Have at least 3 – 6 years of lighting design works, Engineering or Architectural project management experiences.
Scope:
Project management produces engineering solutions for efficient and effective project delivery.
Handle research and development of new products and future lighting solutions
Support daily operations and administration for the smooth operation of the firm
Undertake lighting study tasks and participate in lighting-related competitions
The individual will be exposed to a multidisciplinary approach; (Engineering, Marketing, Business, Site work, Project management, making decisions)
Work closely with clients to develop lighting design solutions for façade, interior or landscape lighting, or related lighting technology applications.
Presentation of lighting design, produce calculations, sketches, cut sheets, renderings, shop drawings, technical specifications to illustrate conceptual ideas.
Prepare budget and power consumption estimates.
Presentation to clients on the design
Project management, review suppliers/contractors proposed lighting products, fittings, and circuitry layouts.
Take part in lighting design or relevant international competitions
Attend site inspections to review the quality and perform project coordination with relevant parties
Regular and clearly define training objective and program (on the job training mainly) will be required
As lighting people, please be prepared for nightworks or over weekends.
What you can learn
Global trends in lighting, semiconductor, nano-technology, light fidelity industry, wireless technology
Knowledge in lighting hard-wares and relevant technologies that complements lighting and visual displays
Sales skills, research, and presentation on possible solutions for MNC and SME entities.
Interactive and experiential lighting setups for creative marketing agencies (local/overseas opportunities)
A fast-paced, high adrenaline environment, challenging timelines, and deliverables are to be expected.
Performing high-level data gathering, SWOT analysis, industry trend identification, digital marketing
External: Sourcing, purchasing, conduct due diligence on product, suppliers, and their processes
Enhance operational capability, improve internal processes, and getting relevant productivity and quality control certificates
To consolidate/document down the knowledge in lighting hard-wares and relevant technologies that complements lighting and visual displays.
Being with a consultancy firm, you will gain knowledge of how consultancy works are strategized, developed, and executed
Individuals should have an interest and/or possess the following basics;
Ability to independently research and present findings in a report format within deadlines
Resourceful and driven to achieve sales results and establish relationships with people
The adventurous spirit that dares to be creative and explore/execute ideas
A basic understanding of electrical, electronic, business marketing, and advertising is a bonus but not an absolute
Able to work with tight timelines and loves challenges
Critical to be a team player, honest, mature, responsible, and having integrity
Interior / Architectural Design, Engineering, Technology, Business, Marketing, Sales
Salary and remuneration:
Starting Basic SGD3,500 to SGD 5,000 (open for negotiation for experience individual)
Basic medical and insurance coverage
14 days annual leave
Possible annual bonus and after per assignment/project bonus subject to overall team and individual performance
Company Gym membership

For interested applicants, please refer to our website www.illuminatingasia.com and youtube channels for more information. You may send your CV and cover letter of why you are a good fit for this position to HR@illuminatingasia.com

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

In this role, you will be responsible for planning, executing, and overseeing the implementation of an ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) system and system migration project. Your primary focus will be on ensuring the successful completion of these projects within scope, on time, and within budget.

Project Planning:Collaborate with stakeholders to define project goals, objectives, and scope.
Develop comprehensive project plans, including timelines, milestones, and resource allocation.
Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies.

Assign tasks and responsibilities to team members and ensure accountability.
Foster a collaborative and productive team environment.
Resource Management:Monitor and manage project resources, including budget, and technology.
Coordinate procurement of necessary hardware, software, and external services.
Maintain clear documentation of resource allocation.
Communication:Act as the primary point of contact for project-related communications.
Regularly update stakeholders on project progress, issues, and changes.
Facilitate effective communication between technical and non-technical team members.
Quality Assurance:Implement best practices and quality standards in project execution.
Perform thorough testing and validation of the ERP system and migration process.
Ensure data integrity and security throughout the migration.
Risk Management:Continuously assess project risks and develop strategies to mitigate them.
Proactively identify and address any roadblocks or issues that may impact project timelines or outcomes.
Documentation:Maintain detailed project documentation, including plans, reports, and change logs.
Create user guides and training materials for the ERP system.
Prepare post-implementation reports and lessons learned documentation.
Training and Support:Coordinate end-user training sessions and provide ongoing support.
Address user inquiries and issues related to the ERP system and migration.
Qualifications:
Minimim Diploma in IT, Computer Science, or a related field.
Fresh Graduates are welcome to apply
Proven experience in project coordination or management, preferably in IT or ERP projects.
Strong organisational and multitasking skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
Knowledge of ERP systems and system migration processes is a plus.
Proficiency in project management software and tools.
Problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Ability to adapt to changing project requirements and priorities.
Benefits:
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunity to work on a critical project that will shape our organization's future.
Collaborative and innovative work environment.
Professional development and growth opportunities.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description of Project Engineer:
We are looking for an experienced project manager to join our civil engineering team. As a project manager, you will be responsible for overseeing and guiding projects from start to finish. Your knowledge and expertise will be invaluable in ensuring that projects are delivered on-time and within budget. You will be working with a highly skilled team of professionals who are dedicated to providing top-quality work and are committed to customer satisfaction.

Responsibilities
• Develop project plans, goals, and budgets.
• Identify and secure resources needed to complete the project.
• Coordinate with all stakeholders to ensure project requirements are met.
• Manage risk and change to ensure successful project delivery.
• Monitor project progress regularly and adjust plans as necessary.
• Communicate project status and updates to all stakeholders.
• Ensure the project is delivered on-time and within budget.
• Foster a positive team environment and work collaboratively with all team members.

Requirements
• Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering or a related field.
• Proven track record of successful project delivery in the civil engineering industry.
• Strong leadership and communication skills.
• Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
• Good understanding of project management software and techniques.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our Client, Singapore's largest finance company is in the midst of expanding their IT Team. This is a great opportunity to join a growing technology team IT. You will be a part of a team to contribute in digital banking projects for the organisation

Role

We are looking for a highly motivated and experienced Digital Banking Project Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of successfully managing complex projects from start to finish. You will be responsible for the overall coordination, status reporting, and stability of project-oriented work efforts. You will also be responsible for assembling project plans and teamwork assignments, directing and monitoring work efforts on a daily basis, tracking key project milestones, and adjusting project plans to meet the needs of customers.


Responsibilities
Manage Digital banking projects, including overall project coordination, deliverables, tracking, and status reporting.
Resolve project issues as necessary with vendors or internal stakeholders.
Manage end-to-end project development life cycle.
Ensure the delivery of change management as part of the project implementation.
Manage backlog, create user stories, execute taskforce, and prioritize project activities.
Deploy user experience based on best practices without compromising the security.
Work with vendor to plan, develop, and implement business requirements, FSD, UAT, training, rollout, and ongoing testing.
Collect test data to identify defects and lead the enhancement process to sign off.
Recommend and implement adequate solutions to resolve issues based on best practices.
Work with cross-functional teams to ideate and create superior digital customer journey.
Engage and communicate with stakeholders to drive development, mitigate risks, and all digital banking associated matters.
Manage project budget, vendor, subcontractor, and relevant resources for the projects.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in relevant fields.
4-7 years of IT work experience, including 4 or more years managing projects.
Experience with projects in multiple technology domains and functions, primarily in the area of digital channels (web and/or app).
Understanding of the complexities and challenges underlying digital technology projects and business implications.
Project manager training and certification desirable, but not mandatory.
4+ years experience managing digital channels (online banking, mobile banking) projects. Preferred if brings experience on large transformation programs

title: Project Coordinator (Operation), HoME+
company_info: Mission & Vision The Singapore Red Cross (SRC) was founded on 30 September 1949 and was subsequently incorporated by an Act of Parliament on 6 April 1973. It is an independent humanitarian organisation that is non-political, non-religious and is part of the International Federation of the Red Cross. SRC adheres to the the Geneva Convention (1949) and bases its work on the fundamental principles of humanity, impartiality, independence, neutrality, unity, universality and voluntary service. Objectives The objectives of the Society are able to provide assistance in relief operations in times of disaster and in auxiliary health and welfare services to the sick, the handicapped, the aged and the poor without any distinction on grounds of race, nationality, religion or political opinions, and to furnish voluntary aid to the sick and wounded in time of war and to non-belligerents, prisoners of war and civilians from the effects of war.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
JOB PURPOSE

The HoME+ Project Coordinator (Operations) is responsible for providing efficient administrative functions and operational support to the Home Monitoring and Eldercare (HoME+) service/program under the Community Services Department of the Singapore Red Cross. This role primarily focuses on managing device installation, uninstallation home assessment, and cash collection for the programme.

HOME MONITORING AND ELDERCARE (HoME+)

About the programme: Home Monitoring and Eldercare (HoME+) is a monitoring system using sensors placed around the home. When inactivity is detected or when the user activates the panic button, the Red Cross' call centre is notified immediately. Depending on the situation, community responders or the SCDF (for emergencies) will be dispatched to provide assistance.

PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES

Operation Support
Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to ensure effective coordination and collaboration.
Manage the installation, uninstallation, and maintenance of HoME+ devices in clients' homes.
Conduct home visits to both current and potential clients, assessing their needs and providing support.
Collect fees from HoME+ clients promptly and accurately.
Administration Support
Ensure that HoME+ payments are accurately recorded and regularly updated
Process monthly payments and fees, ensuring accuracy and adherence to financial procedures.
Update clients' biodata accurately and in a timely manner.
Respond to general program inquiries via email and phone, providing prompt and helpful assistance.
Assist with putting up purchase requisitions and orders when necessary.
Perform other administrative duties as assigned by the supervisor.
Any Other Duties
Undertake or Participate in department and society events or activities
Support in volunteer recruitment and engagement activities.
Attend to HoME+ activation.
Any other ad-hoc projects.
JOB REQUIREMENTS

Additional Skills and Knowledge
Good command of both spoken and written English
Other spoken native language ie dialect will be an advantage
Computer literate
Good interpersonal and organisational skills
Meticulous with an eye for details and multi-task effectively
High initiative
Desired Behaviour
Independent with the ability to relate well to people of all levels
Task-oriented and outcome driven
Demonstrate initiative and ability to work as a team above and beyond the job scope
Adaptable to the changing needs on the ground.
Willingness to work on weekends.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Role: Project Manager


Salary Range: S$4,000 - S$8,000

Working Hours: Mon-Fri, 0900-1800hrs. However, you may be required to work outside of these hours in accordance with prevailing business needs.

You will be embedded with the Client, which is an MNC in the tech sector.


Background of Role;

The Embedded Project Manager (‘EPM’), is responsible for managing internal projects for the Client. The aim of the role is to supervise LSP/Vendors to achieve FDOB throughout APAC by:

● Delivery of effective and efficient supervision, centralised management to APAC Projects.

● Coordination, communication, and improvement of all Security System related processes.


Job Duties;

The Project Manager shall be responsible for:

● Coordinating internal resources and third parties/vendors for the flawless execution of
projects.

● Managing changes to the project scope, project schedule and project costs using appropriate
tools assigned.

● Reporting and escalating issues to the APAC Lead as needed.

● Managing the relationship with the clients, vendors and all stakeholders.

● Creating and maintain comprehensive project documentation.

● Leading the cross functional team(System Admin, EPE, Project Support, PMO etc) to complete
the assigned tasks/projects.


Job Requirements;

● Strong organisational skills with an ability to multitask.

● Good working knowledge of Security Systems (Access Control and CCTV platforms).

● Team player and self-starter with ability to work independently.

● Good problem-solving skills.

● Experience in Security System maintenance and project delivery.

● Good general IT knowledge.

● Minimum of 6 years experience in the Security Industry or Minimum of 5 years working
experience with a EE/IT Bachelor degree.

● Certification in ACS and CCTV platform is needed.

● MNC clients Experience is needed.

● Fluent English Speaking and writing skills.



Additional Value-Added Qualities that we are looking for (not a must);

● Familiar with Motorola Radio System - first priority to candidates with relevant experience.

● To provide technical solution to resolve Security System issue.

● Improve workflows, processes, procedures, maximising efficiency and quality of systems.

● 5 years of experience in SI as PM.

● 3 years of experience in SI as technical Roles(Technician, System Engineer, TPM etc).

● 2 years of MNC Experience with Software House (CCURE Product).

● 3 years of experience with Enterprise Systems (Lenel, Honeywell etc).

● At least 1 years of Multinational Project Management or Technical Support Experience.

● Bilingual (English + Any Asian Language).


For keen applicants, please click "Apply" now!

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Direct Search Global is working with the leading retail brand solution provider to fill the role of Project Executive in Singapore. The office is located at Jurong East area.

Why this job?
This company successfully designed, built, and managed retail interior fit-out for top international brands. All these retail presences are activated in more than 100 countries including America, South America, Europe, and Asia. This job allows you to travel around the world and engage with the top brands in completing the interior fit-out projects.

Who should apply?
A project coordinator who has at least 3 years of relevant work experience and is hungry to learn and acquire new experience. The suitable candidate must be flexible to work at night and travel outside of Singapore to visit project site if necessary.

Job Responsibilities:
Project Planning: Collaborate with the Operations Manager to create comprehensive action plans for projects, including resource allocation and timeframes.
Coordination: Perform various coordination tasks, such as schedule and risk management, to ensure projects stay on track.
Administrative Duties: Maintain project documentation and complete reports as necessary for effective project management.
Client Interaction: Collaborate with clients and internal teams to deliver results on time and to meet client expectations.
Stakeholder Coordination: Coordinate with various stakeholders to ensure project deliverables conform to schedules and client requirements.
Contractor Briefing: Provide contractors with project setup requirements and timelines.
Liaison: Communicate with the internal team on project and site drawings, as well as with vendors on project-related matters.
Problem Solving: Address and resolve project problems to meet client expectations.
Independent Work: Be capable of working independently in all aspects of project management.
Job Requirements:
A minimum of 3 years of experience in retail fixture projects is required.
Good knowledge of the technical process related to retail projects.
Ability to communicate effectively with subcontractors and workers.
Minimum qualifications include an ‘O’ Level certificate, Diploma, or Degree.
Minimum of 3-5 years of related project management experience at the project site.
At least 2 years of experience in interior fit-out, especially in retail projects.
Possess excellent communication and presentation skills.
Able to multitask, work under pressure, and meet tight deadlines.
Strong organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work well in a team.
Willingness to work night shifts and weekends during projects.
Knowledge of AutoCAD is considered an added advantage.
Be prepared for travel within Southeast Asia (SEA) and India as required for project-related activities.

company_info: ENGIE Services Singapore Pte Ltd (ENGIE), is a leading provider of Integrated Facilities Management solutions (IFM), property management, operation and maintenance, specialised rail engineering works, sustainable solutions and FM Consultancy services. The company operates across a wide spectrum of mission-critical industries and markets, including aviation, transportation, healthcare, education, government and commercial projects. With more than 30 clients all over Singapore, 4 decade of experience in facilities management and specialised engineering services and with over 1,100 direct staff, ENGIE consistently delivers best-in-class service standards, offers reliable support and proven expertise in managing mission-critical facilities and operations for our clients. ENGIE Services Singapore is part of the ENGIE group, a global energy player and an expert operator in the three key sectors of electricity, natural gas and energy services. The Group supports changes in society that are based as much on economic growth as on, social progress and the preservation of natural resources. · With our proven track records as a one-stop integrated facilities and specialised engineering specialist, we conduct trainings and continuous skill upgrading to our technical staff as well as vendors / partners supporting the project; · Monitor & reviewing of monthly key performance indicators with our clients, through a strong governance structure; · High performance management and effective technical operation in collaboration with specialist contractor / vendors; · Implement crisis management and recovery; · Provide active roles in the initiatives on Environmental, Health and Safety (EHS) programmes; · Schedule and forecast of annual planned maintenance work and schedules to ensure seamless service delivery. About ENGIE Group ENGIE develops its businesses (power, natural gas, energy services) around a model based on responsible growth to take on the major challenges of energy’s transition to a low-carbon economy: access to sustainable energy, climate-change mitigation and adaptation and the rational use of resources. The Group provides individuals, cities and businesses with highly efficient and innovative solutions largely based on its expertise in four key sectors: renewable energy, energy efficiency, liquefied natural gas and digital technology. ENGIE employs 154,950 people worldwide and achieved revenues of €69.9 billion in 2015. The Group is listed on the Paris and Brussels stock exchanges (ENGI) and is represented in the main international indices: CAC 40, BEL 20, DJ Euro Stoxx 50, Euronext 100, FTSE Eurotop 100, MSCI Europe, DJSI World, DJSI Europe and Euronext Vigeo (Eurozone 120, Europe 120 and France 20). company_info: A general builder and contractor in the field of construction specializing in the renovation, A&A, reinstatement, construction and general work for residential, industrial, commercial and factories.
address: NORTH POINT BIZHUB, 2 YISHUN INDUSTRIAL STREET 1 768159
job_category: Building and Construction, General Management, General Work, Risk Management
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Oversee and manage construction/renovation projects from start to finish, ensuring adherence to quality standards, timeline, and budgetary constraints.
Coordinate and supervise the work of subcontractors, workers and suppliers.
Monitor construction/renovation progress, identify and resolve any issues or challenges that may arise on-site.
Ensure everyone on site comply with safety regulations and maintain a safe working environment.
Collaborate with architects, engineers, consultants, owners and all relevant parties and authorities to ensure project runs smoothly and objectives are met.
Conduct regular site inspections and quality checks to ensure workmanship meets company standards.
Daily briefing/reminders to workers and sub-contractors either the evening before or in the morning before work start on the work to be done and the progress that needs to be met for the day.
Assists in purchasing materials and tools at times and help fetch workers from site to site when necessary
Prepare progress reports and communicate daily work progress updates to the Director.
Requirements:
Minimum 5 years of relevant full-time working experience in construction and/or renovation project supervision in Singapore.
Required to possess a BCSS/CSOC certificate.
Required to possess a construction-related diploma recognized by BCA/PEB.
Required to possess a BCCPE certificate.
Required to possess a Class 3 driving license.
Added advantage if you possess a bizSAFE Level 2 (Risk Management Course) certificate.
Experienced in small scale projects, A&A and renovation work for residential, industrial, commercial and factories (experience in HIP an added advantage).
Strong knowledge of construction/renovation rules and regulations, it's requirements, methods, materials, safety and processes.
Have experience and knowledge in all Risk Assessments (RA), management and report related.
Excellent leadership and communication skills to effectively manage a diverse team.
Ability to read and interpret construction drawings and specifications.
Proficient in computer and using microsoft office softwares and other relevant tools (for work-related).
Ability to write English and speak both English and Mandarin/Hokkien.
Long term commiment.
Singaporeans and PRs are preferred.
*Salary is open to negotiation based on your credentials.
