title: WD30186885 Senior Project Engineer - HVAC Project -
company_info: Johnson Controls (www.johnsoncontrols.com) is the global leader that brings ingenuity to the places where people live, work and travel. By integrating technologies, products and services, Johnson Controls creates smart environments that redefine the relationships between people and their surroundings. With a global team of 140,000 employees, Johnson Controls creates a more comfortable, safe and sustainable world through value-added products and services for more than two hundred million vehicles, twelve million homes and one million commercial buildings. Johnson Controls’ commitment to sustainability drives environmental stewardship, good corporate citizenship in the workplaces and communities, and the products and services provided to customers. Founded in 1885 by Professor Warren Johnson to manufacture his invention, the electric room thermostat, Johnson Controls has grown into a global leader in Automotive Experience, Building Efficiency and Power Solutions. As a Fortune 100 company with over $38 billion in annual revenue (NYSE: JCI), the company provides innovative automotive interiors that help make driving more comfortable, safe and enjoyable. For buildings, it offers products and services that optimize energy use and improve comfort and security. Johnson Controls also provides batteries for automobiles and hybrid electric vehicles, along with systems engineering and service expertise.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
What you will do:
Oversees activity to ensure that project is completed in accordance with scope, budget, codes, and schedule as bound by contract. Delegates tasks to execute and fully complete assigned projects. Coordinates communication with customer during all phases of the project. Coordinates the work of subcontractors
How you will do it:
Define scope, budget and schedule for projects
Device project implementation methodology
Plan and oversee work schedule for the multiple small to medium scale project under responsibility, in coordination with supervisor.
Identify potential project risks and recommend appropriate resolutions
Establish effective communication with customer
Track and update progress, task and project health to supervisors
Ensure and monitor compliance to applicable codes, practices, QA/QC policies, performance standards and specifications. Perform regular quality audit for all the suppliers and sub-contractors.
Identify and secure variation order.
Cost control. Track, monitor and ensure delivery of financial commitment as per CIS.
Managing reports and documents
Work closely with Sales team for tender bidding
Supervision of sub-contractors’ work at site.
Schedule purchase and deliveries of all materials for the project in a timely manner
Assign task to, and supervise Assistant Project Engineer, Technician, if any
System applications, drafting, data base generation and commissioning
Follow-up on payment from customers and verify payment to our suppliers.
Train customer and provide first year maintenance warranty schedule visit.
Hand over project to customer and later to service team.
What we look for:
Diploma with minimum 5 years relevant experience in Building Services, M&E or construction.
Competent in Chiller Plant and airside replacement.
Excel, Word and Project essential
2 years of supervisory experience
Require interaction with clients, consultants and sub-contractors, etc.
Need to work odd hours as and when required, whenever the work need to be done on time.
What we offer:
Competitive salary
Paid vacation/holidays/sick time
Comprehensive benefits package
On the job/cross training opportunities
Encouraging and collaborative team environment
Dedication to safety through our Zero Harm policy

title: Facilities Coordinator
company: JONES LANG LASALLE TECHNOLOGY SERVICES PTE. LTD.
company_info: JONES LANG LASALLE TECHNOLOGY SERVICES PTE. LTD.
address: PAYA LEBAR QUARTER, 1 PAYA LEBAR LINK 408533
job_category: Admin / Secretarial, Building and Construction, Customer Service, Hospitality, Real Estate / Property Management
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Work Dynamics - Integrated Facilities Management
Leading Global Technology company
(Singapore)
DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
The FC is responsible for providing excellent customer service and creating an exceptional experience to all staff, TVCs, their guests and vendors who are their business partners. The FC must be able to effectively communicate information verbally regarding the building, the office and its facilities, and facilities in and around the area. Additionally, it is the responsibility of the POC to maintain the cleanliness, comfort, safety, and overall appearance of their assigned area to the highest standards, either through self performance or vendors. The FC must be able to offer assistance to all staff at this site. The expression “Going above and beyond” is a normal operating standard for this position. The FC will perform any other tasks that may be assigned to them which is related but not exclusive to customer service, hospitality and experience, finance and admin, project coordination, the broad spectrum of facilities & building management and operations (hard and soft services, transport and waste management, etc), space planning, event management and any others that may fall within the scope mentioned.
This position requires the individual to be able to multitask, quick minded, independent and reliable. In addition, the individual is expected to remain poised, polite and professional during any people conflicts. Maturity, a cool head and fun-loving attitude is necessary. Individuals are required to support during off working hours if there is a work requirement.
Create and provide memorable and exceptional experience for all clients, internal and external, in the client office:
Ensure messaging is consistent and in line with directions given by the Supervisor.
Respond to client inquiries and concerns promptly and with courtesy and enthusiasm.
Build relationships by engaging clients in authentic, personable conversations.
Create WOW experiences by anticipating client needs and seizing the moment; acting on them before being requested
Provide a positive environment where things get done
Take ownership of customer issues and proactively seek to resolve them quickly.
Provide end to end service; take responsibility and accountability.
Provide exceptional communication to clients:
Communicate effectively and correctly.
Respond, follow up and close – both via email and in person in a timely manner.
Maintain current/up to date knowledge of the building and office procedures and client/guest-related information including, but not limited to:
Information about the history of the office location, and the office design concept
Information on the facilities of the building, in the office, and of the general area
General event management
Reception duties
Vendor Management
Emergency response procedure and incident reporting.
Patrol and check the office for cleanliness issues, safety (and security) hazards and document any irregularities:
Be the eyes and ears of the EHSS and soft services/hard services/ operations team. Maintain the general presentation of the office by appropriately notifying departments/owners responsible for the maintenance, or to self-perform the remedy immediately, regardless whether it is a temporary or permanent solution, and where it is possible to do so without compromising on safety and standards.
Report infractions immediately and according to procedure.
Report and log data on unusual occurrences such as property damage, injuries, theft, etc and create detailed incident reports in a timely manner:
Gather information in accordance with procedure and prepare incident reports within KPI or policy guidelines and free from errors.
Provide back-up support and cover to absent team members. Provide emergency on-site attendance as needed:
Carry out tasks relating to customer service, hospitality and experience, administration, the broad spectrum of facilities & building management and operations (hard and soft services, transport and waste management, etc), space planning, event management and any others that may fall within the scope mentioned.
Critical Competencies for Success:
Great attitude:
Proactive and positive
Gung-ho and can-do attitude
Solution oriented
Client Focus & Relationship Management:
Demonstrates proactive and professional approach to customer service and stakeholder engagement
Able to interact with a wide range of client staff, including senior levels and support staff
Able to manage conflict and balance between client and JLL requirements
Has a customer service oriented attitude
Leadership, Collaboration and Team Worker:
Able to effectively lead a group of people to meet objectives, and promote open, constructive and collaborative relationships at all levels
Able to work collaboratively and be part of a team working towards meeting deliverables
Project Management & Organizational Skills:
Excellent planning & organizational skills, ability to prioritize work and meet tight deadlines
Proven ability to manage multiple operational matters on a daily basis
Providing onsite support:
You will be the upper facilities management’s trusted right hand on all facilities-related activities.
Perform routine site inspections to ensure all building processes and best practices are implemented and maintained.
Problem Solving & Strategic Thinking:
Capacity to deal with ambiguity and solve problems effectively
Analytical
Able to employ holistic approaches and looks at long term solutions
Other Personal Characteristics:
Strong communicator
Good presentation skills and possesses strong verbal & written communication skills (English & local language).
Skilled at using positive language
An active listener
Passion for quality
Has an eye for detail to make sure the best delivery of services
Self-motivated
Confident and energetic
Enthusiastic

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Planning Engineer /Project Engineer/Project Manager
- Civil / Building / Interior Design Project Coordinator
Senior Project Engineer (Civil/Building) - $4.5K-$6.5K

Develop, maintain and manage working relationships with clients and all related parties.
Manage and implement overall project.
Coordinate with Project Manager on project matters
Supervise and provide advice to junior Project Engineer(s)
Check working drawing, identify discrepancies for resolution
Keeping track on variation and claims of contract
Perform project cost review on a regular basis and on identified areas.
Plan and manage project schedule to ensure timely delivery.
Perform incoming inspection on project materials delivered on site by suppliers or vendors.
Site coordination with subcontractors, supervisors and clients.
Ad-hoc duties as assigned by superior(s).
Job Requirements
Degree in Civil & Structural Engineering (Certificates must be recognized by PE Board).
Possess skills, knowledge and ability to supervise and manage project effectively
Independent, resulted-oriented and self-driven team player with good communication skills
Class 3 driving license will be added advantage.

Asst Project Manager/Project Manager ($5.5K-$7.5K)
Reporting to senior management, you will have overall responsibility for the effective implementation and successful completion of construction projects undertaken by the Group within schedule, cost and quality.
You will liaise closely with subcontractors, architects, consultants and authorities.
Set guidelines and provide expertise and supervision to the team.
You will effectively manage each phase of the project from design to completion and ensure efficient use of resources and enhance cost-effectiveness.
Requirements
Candidates must possess a Degree in Civil Engineering with at least 5 years relevant working experience in a managerial position.
Other pre-requisites are excellent team spirit, strong technical competence, good interpersonal skills and with a "can-do" attitude.

Planning Engineer (Civil/Interior/Building) Responsibilities
· Developing and preparing Tender Plans, Pre-construction programs / Labor Histograms .
· Develop Baseline Program including EPS, OBS, WBS, Phasing / Zoning Strategy Plan and Key Dates/ Milestones, of the project assuring that the Program is fulfilling all the contractual requirements.
· Detailed Planning & scheduling for various stages of the projects that involved works related to various disciplines such as Contracts, Engineering ,Procurement and Construction
· Assigning Recourses to the project, monitoring the resources allocation and taking actions if there are any conflicts or peaks.
· Developing Cost Breakdown Structure and produce the project cash flow, making sure that the project is always within the budget / Cost control.
· Proactively monitoring the overall Work progress & Contractors Performance.
· Review the progress status reports of all the contractors on board.
· Prepare and issue monthly reports of project progress.
· Update & Monitor the overall Baseline Schedule & Key Dates.
· Preparation and updating of S-Curves, Resources Histogram and monthly Cash Flow.
· Managing the program’s Resources Histograms, monitoring the progress against Planned Figures and realized benefits as the program progresses.
· Responsible for supporting the Senior Project Manager, highlighting the areas of concerns, Issues or order to take corrective actions and implementing the preventive actions in order to avoid similar issues in the future.
· Review of major scope changes, ensuring that any impact on time is assessed.
· Responsible for assessing time extension requests and provide recommendations against the same.
· Travel to the site offices for visiting the projects / updating the progress when its needed
· Preparation of Time Impact Analysis
· Recognised qualification in Building Services Engineering or other appropriate engineering subject is preferred. Candidates without formal engineering qualifications may be considered if they have acquired sufficient experience (minimum 4 years in the role of a relevant construction management position) to demonstrate competence in the skills necessary to fulfil the role.
· Membership of professional body preferred
· Computer literate – Prima Vera/Microsoft Office
· 4 years of industry relevant experience

Project Coordinator
To manage projects by supervising and coordinating the site activities
Monitoring of work progress, attending project meetings, liaising with clients and consultants
Assist Project Manager in carrying out all shop drawings, method statements submission
Ensures the timely preparation of project progress reports, inspection records, handover records, defects list etc.
Record all defects of works, ensure proper documentation for all variation orders and others
Ability to complete and hand over projects within tight timeline and quality expectation
To make pro-active response on site problems and resolved immediately with the Project team
To ensure all aspect of QA and QC matters
Observe proper construction safety measures and ensure safety compliance at site
Requirements:
Minimum Diploma Holder or other relevant qualifications
Min 3 years of relevant working experience in interior fit-out works or construction field is required
Able to work independently and under tight schedule
Good project coordination and management skill
Able to read architectural & technical drawings thus translates to construction activities
Good working knowledge of MS Office and Outlook

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Regional Project Coordinator to join our team. The incumbent will play a pivotal role in coordinating and managing projects across the region, working closely with various internal and external stakeholders. The ideal candidate should possess a minimum of 2 to 3 years of relevant experience, with strong project management skills, exceptional communication abilities, and a customer-centric approach. Market research background is highly preferred.

Key Responsibilities:
Coordinate and manage projects across the region, ensuring successful execution from initiation to completion.
Act as a point of contact for regional stakeholders, addressing inquiries, providing updates, and managing expectations.
Monitor project progress, identify potential risks, and proactively implement corrective actions to ensure project objectives are met.
Foster effective communication among project stakeholders, keeping all parties informed about project updates, milestones, and changes.
Provide excellent customer service by addressing inquiries, resolving issues, and maintaining a positive relationship with clients and partners.
Utilize MS Office tools to create comprehensive reports, presentations, and project-related documentation.
Prepare and deliver regular project status reports and presentations to senior management and stakeholders.
Qualifications and Skills:
Diploma or Bachelor's degree in a relevant field, with knowledge of quantitative or qualitative research methodologies.
2 to 3 years of experience in a research or coordination role.
Strong project management skills, including the ability to prioritize tasks, manage resources, and meet deadlines.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to effectively interact with internal teams and external stakeholders.
Exceptional customer service mindset with the ability to anticipate and address client needs.
Problem-solving aptitude with a proactive and adaptable approach to challenges.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail to ensure thorough project execution and documentation.
Benefits and Career Path:
Attractive remuneration
Excellent growth prospects

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Location: Tuas
Lunch provided, Company transport provided

Working Hours:
Monday to Friday: Office hours
Able to support after office hours on urgent customer orders

Job Scope:
Responsible and accountable for Protective Coating Project orders. Full spectrum from PO receives to final delivery.
Ensure efficiency and accuracy for overall order processing from order receipt, fulfillment to shipment. Raises issues in delivery and/or documents process with respective function teams.
Work cross-functionally to support the timely delivery of all products to the customers.
Ensure order entry accuracy in SAP systems. Entertain internal and external customers’ WhatsApp during office hours and after office hours if any.
Manage customer order issues by constantly working close with counterparts in Sales, Logistics, Planning, Transporter, and Invoicing team to make necessary rectifications.
Track and follow up on orders supplying locally. (OBD push till final delivery)
Liaise with the supply/demand team to arrange inward supply for projects required.
Manage goods return from customers as per company policies and guidelines.
Manage and clear backlog through regular weekly review and change and update RDD Daily.
Assists and supports in ad hoc tasks relating to order processing and process improvement when required.
Adheres to all applicable corporate as well as site policies/procedures regarding personal conduct/HS&E standards and acts in compliance with all regulations.
Assist Invoicing team to ensure the order can be invoiced.
Ensure delivery of key projects and new product development plan
Monitor project milestones against a timeline and identify gaps and remedy actions.
Schedule project meetings, prepare agenda, document meeting minutes, and track actions.
Provide regular and timely progress updates to project customers.
Prepare portfolio dashboards and reports for management review.
Maintain PMO process governance with periodic checks on compliance.
Ensure that all aspects of a project are organized and in conformance with timeline and deliverables requirement
Develop and maintain project performance database that tracks overall progress and achievement of milestones
Assign and monitor resources effectively to boost project efficiency and maximize deliverables output
Report project risks and outcomes to appropriate management channels, and escalate issues according to project work plan
Serve as point of communication between company teams and external resources

Requirements:
Candidate with relevant background in order management in a very fast-paced environment
Three or more years of experience in project coordination
Experience in coordinating teams and clients
Proven success in a corporate setting, working with all levels of management.
Knowledge of Microsoft Office
Knowledge of SAP (SD & PM) system – run reports and update, project tracker
Possess problem-solving skills and a deadline-oriented ability to work under pressure within a tight timeline.
Good communication and interpersonal skills – respect everyone internally and externally
A good team player who can work independently with minimum supervision.

Interested applicants, please email your updated CV to rachel.lim@recruitexpress.com.sg or WA 97527630 for more information.

Provide sales support to designated countries where necessary
Coordinate the preparation of full set of shipping documentation to customers
Handle customer requests for samples and coordinating sample dispatch from plant/warehouse
To organize and control project activities involving Customer Service organization down to implementation of project objectives.
The Projects may be initiated within the Customer Service organization within APAC or Globally, Projects can also be driven by Global or Regional Business Line(s) initiatives
Includes coordinating meetings, resources, equipment and information
Manage project-related paperwork by ensuring all necessary materials are current, properly filed and stored
Oversee the project progress and track against established milestones
Other ad hoc duties assigned
Job Requirements
Minimum 8-10 years in an MNC and Customer Service environment
Knowledge in logistics, shipping including Order-to-Cash processes of at least 5-8 years
Familiar with export documentation e.g. Letter of Credit, Bill of Lading, Airway Bill, Export Letter of Credit orders, preparation of banking documents using Trade Services online banking system etc.
Basic knowledge of Financing, Credit Management and Global Trade Services will be advantageous
Exposure in process mapping, working in a Supply Chain/Customer Service environment is an advantage
Experienced in using SAP system and MS Office, Visio is an advantage
Interested applicants please send your resumes to jessica.nguyen@recruitexpress.com.sg

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Purpose
The Project Coordinator shall assists Project Manager in oversees the planning, implementation, execute, monitor and track projects from beginning till end with specified deliverables.
The role of the Project Coordinator will be able to learn and equip with a full suite of comprehensive exposure and knowledge on Project management that covers proposal, product sourcing, timeline management, cost and resource control and quality management.
Primary Duties and Responsibilities
The Project Coordinator shall assists Project Manager performs a comprehensive range of duties including some or all of the following:
Job Requirement:
Coordination work, planning and monitoring site's workforce and multi-disciplinary works from inception to completion, inclusive of project documentation, plans and reports etc.
To ensure that the project runs smoothly by tracking project progress, effectively and accurately communicate relevant project information to the client, Management and Project Team.
To ensure all project requirements are within the standards & control of the project management plan.
Able to multi-task and manage several things at one time
Able to handle stress/pressure and work hard with tight deadlines
Any other works as assigned by superior.
Requirement:
· Singapore, Singapore PR or Malaysian.
· ITE Level. Preferably in Electrical and or Mechanical or Manufacturing
· Fresh grads or 1 year working experience may apply.
· Working hours – 0830 to 1730hrs Monday to Friday.

title: Project Coordinator
company_info: No information added.
job_category: Admin / Secretarial, Building and Construction, Engineering, General Management, Risk Management
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our growing company is seeking to hire a project coordinator who will be in charge of assisting our project managers in organizing our ongoing projects. This task involves monitoring project plans, schedules, work hours, budgets, and expenditures, organizing and participating in stakeholder meetings, and ensuring that project deadlines are met in a timely manner.

Project Coordinator
Responsibilities:
· Maintaining and monitoring project plans, project schedules, work hours, budgets and expenditures.
· Organizing, attending, and participating in stakeholder meetings.
· Documenting and following up on important actions and decisions from meetings.
· Preparing necessary presentation materials for meetings.
· Ensuring project deadlines are met.
· Determining project changes.
· Providing administrative support as needed.
· Undertaking project tasks as required.
· Developing project strategies.
· Ensuring projects adhere to frameworks and all documentation is maintained appropriately for each project.
· Assess project risks and issues and provide solutions where applicable.
· Ensure stakeholder views are manged towards the best solution.
· Chair and facilitate meetings where appropriate and distribute minutes to all project team members.
· Create a project management calendar for fulfilling each goal and objective.

Project Coordinator Requirements
· Diploma in business or related field of study.
· Three years of experience in related field.
· Exceptional verbal, written and presentation skills.
· Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.
· Experience using computers for a variety of tasks
· Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel and Outlook.

title: Project Coordinator
company_info: dMC Event Management is a total marketing solutions provider and a one-stop design, production and events agency. We help companies achieve their business and campaign goals through events that hit objectives on-target. We develop ideas to generate brand awareness, meet key objectives, reinforce messages, and create unique and memorable experiences. We are a resource-rich and highly driven company backed by a dynamic and skilled team. DMC’s track record is proven in over 20 markets around the Asia Pacific. Today, we are one of the region’s most trusted and highly sought after events management agency, being reputed for transforming creative concepts into living, breathing realities.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Us:
dMC is a leading event management company known for creating unforgettable and seamless experiences for a diverse range of clients. We specialize in planning and executing corporate events, conferences, weddings, and social gatherings with utmost precision and creativity. Our team is passionate about delivering exceptional results, and we are seeking a Project Coordinator to join us in our mission.

Job Overview:
As a Project Coordinator at dMC, you will play a pivotal role in the successful execution of events. You will collaborate closely with clients, vendors, and the internal team to ensure that all aspects of the event planning process are handled efficiently and effectively. Your experience in the event industry will be invaluable in managing complex projects and delivering exceptional events that exceed client expectations.

Job Responsibilities:
- Planning, coordination, and execution of events, ranging from roadshows to corporate conferences.
- Serve as the main point of contact for clients, ensuring clear communication and understanding of their event goals and requirements.
- Develop and manage event timelines, budgets, and resources to ensure projects are completed on schedule and within budget.
- Source and negotiate with vendors and suppliers to secure the best services and pricing for events.
- Oversee event logistics, including venue selection, catering, audiovisual setup, decor, and transportation.
- Manage event registration processes, attendee lists, and post-event evaluations.
- Provide on-site supervision during events to ensure seamless execution and troubleshoot any unforeseen issues.

Job Qualifications:
- Fresh Diploma/ Nitec graduates in Event Management or related qualifications are welcome to apply.
- Proven track record of successfully coordinating and executing events of various sizes and complexities.
- Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
- Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal.
- Detail-oriented mindset and a proactive problem solver.

Job Benefits:
- Opportunity to work on a wide variety of events for prestigious clients.
- Collaborative and creative work environment.
- Professional growth and development opportunities.

Application Process:
To apply for the position of Project Coordinator at dMC, please submit your resume, a cover letter detailing your relevant experience, and any event portfolio if available. Applications should be sent to marketing@dmcevent.com with the subject line "Project Coordinator Application - [Your Name]".
We look forward to reviewing your application and potentially welcoming you to our dynamic team at dMC Event.

title: Coordination Manager
company_info: Sato Kogyo traces its roots to one of the oldest turnkey contractors in Japan. Established in 1862 and headquartered in Tokyo, Sato Kogyo laid the cornerstone of modern building technology by focusing on and developing newer and more efficient construction methodologies that are still relevant around the world today. Over a rich history of more than 140 years, Sato Kogyo has accomplished numerous types of building and civil engineering projects of varying scale, nature and complexity from Japan to United States, Singapore to Malaysia and Thailand to China. In 1972, the firm recognised the growing construction activities in the Asia Pacific region and spreaded its wings beyond the shores of Japan. Expanding rapidly in response to its success, Sato Kogyo set up offices in Singapore, Kuala Lumpur, Bangkok and Xi’an. The strength of the Singapore Office has evolved into a Regional Headquarters in 2002 to oversee the emerging East Asian markets.

The Project Coordinator is to supports the Design Department in gathering equipment, resources and information to implement upcoming projects. A professional Project Coordinator should be able to fulfill various duties and responsibilities. They should be able to work closely with the whole team to create comprehensive action plans concerning resources, budgets and timeframes for projects. Project managers perform various coordinating duties such as scheduling and risk management. The following are additional duties and responsibilities that a project coordinator should be able to do:

Participate in project design meetings and propose improvements if necessary
Evaluate potential problems and technical hitches and develop solutions
Plan and manage team goals, project schedules and new information
Supervise current projects and coordinate all team members to keep workflow on track
Manage project-related paperwork by ensuring all necessary materials are current, properly filed and stored
Direct project correspondences by preparing and reviewing project proposals, memos, meeting minutes and emails
Communicate with clients to identify and define project requirements, scope and objectives
Adhere to budget by monitoring expenses and implementing cost-saving measures

General knowledge on site with architecture and structure for private landed houses

title: Project Coordinator / Admin / PMO (Technology - Banking) - RT
company: SMART INFORMATION MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS PRIVATE LIMITED
company_info: About the Company: Smart IMS delivers IT solutions that create a sustainable competitive advantage for its clients across the world. The company was founded by business and technology experts with extensive backgrounds in designing, implementing, and managing large and complex IT projects at Fortune 500 companies. We are a Cisco and Microsoft Gold certified Partner, specializing in providing end-to-end Infrastructure Management Services (Network, Security, VOIP, Systems, Databases and Applications) across the Globe. Our core portfolio includes IT applications, business process services, and IT transformation services. We leverage our deep industry and functional expertise, leading technology practices, and an advanced global delivery model to help clients transform their highest-value business processes and improve their business performance. Smart IMS is headquartered in Plainsboro, New Jersey (US), with offices in India, Singapore, Sydney, and Dubai. Our Global Delivery Center is located in Hyderabad, India and is a state-of-the art facility designed to accommodate up to 500 employees. It was built using best-of-breed products and solutions from global leaders such as Cisco, HP, Sun, IBM, Oracle, and Microsoft. The high-end configuration infrastructure, built using a fiber-optic backbone, enables high-speed communication links with all our offices and client sites. Smart IMS deploys a global delivery model at the heart of its business operations, leveraging people and infrastructure in different global locations. • Cloud Transformation – IoT, Big Data, ML/AI, Migration • Enterprise Application - Microsoft Dynamics 365 / AX / CRM & Salesforce & Oracle & SAP & Guidewire • Infrastructure Engineering – SDN -WAN, SBC, RMM • Unified Communication – Voice & Data (MS Teams), Contact Center • Application Development & Management • Managed Services – 24/7 in different time zone • Professional Staff Augmentation Services – Onsite/Offshore
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Executive Summary
Smart IMS Inc provides Digital technology & Cloud transformation services, Application & Infrastructure Management Services, Unified Communications and Insurance implementation services to customers across the Americas, Europe, Middle East, and Asia-Pacific regions. As the trusted technology and business partner of leading MNCs, including Global Investment Banks, Smart IMS is also a Microsoft Gold Certified Partner, Oracle Platinum Partner and AWS MSP Partner.
We are looking to hire a Project Coordinator / Admin / PMO to support the Data Center team of our client in Singapore which is a top global investment bank. The incumbent needs to have past experience supporting IT / Technology projects.
Responsibilities
Assist the project manager in such project management documents such as project budgets, project schedules and plans
Monitor and provide updates on project progress
Supporting project finances in the likes of raising purchase request or capital expenses
Responsible for end-to-end purchase process for the department
Track purchase request to purchase order completion, liaise with team leads/vendors on PO status
Conduct finance review meetings with team leads and vendors
Track PO against budget and track materials delivery schedule
Follow up on invoice submission and document control for department purchases
Any ad hoc tasks assigned by leads
Responsibilities
At least 1-3 years of project coordination experience supporting IT / Technology projects.
Past experience handling matters related to project finance / invoice
Knowledge of project tools such as JIRA, Microsoft Projects
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to interact with various stakeholders
Past project experience in the banking / financial services domain would be an advantage

title: Project Coordinator
company: JCDECAUX OUT OF HOME ADVERTISING PTE. LTD.
company_info: At JCDecaux, you'll be part of the world's No. 1 outdoor advertising company. Employing more than 10,000 people globally, the Group is present in more than 80 different countries and generated revenues of more than €2,744M in 2021.It all started in 1964, when our founder Jean-Claude Decaux had an idea that would change cities across the world - to provide and maintain bus shelters free of charge - paid for by the advertising posters displayed on them. Today, JCDecaux Singapore reaches millions of people every day with our advertising products and services that enliven the cityscape and spark conversations. We enable iconic brands and household names to engage with their customers in a unique way whilst helping to shape the look and feel of the outdoor advertising landscape. Our talented people contribute across a wide range of roles; ensuring our clients are connecting with the right audience at Changi Airport, in shopping malls like ION Orchard, Jewel, Raffles City, at bus shelters across the island, in the cinemas and creative media spaces. Voted by clients and agencies as the number one out-of-home media company 10th times over the past decade, we are inclusive, fair and family friendly. We believe that diversity of thought, experience and background provides the platform for great creativity. We value and support our people and believe our people make the difference.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
Assist the project manager in the development of project management documents such as project budgets, project schedules, scope statements and project plans
Execute project management administrative and bookkeeping tasks such as managing invoices, purchase orders and inventory reports, among other financial documents
Supervise the project procurement process (status related)
Meeting with project clients to assess their needs and define project requirements, acceptance criteria and project timelines
Coordinate the allocation of project resources to ensure the project team has what’s needed at the right time
Assign tasks to team members and help them understand what’s expected from them in terms of project milestones and deliverables
Be the liaison between the project team and project clients throughout the project life cycle
Help project manager monitor project progress, team members’ performance, and provide updates to project stakeholders
Schedule stakeholder meetings, document and generate reports
Foster cross-team collaboration to help project team members complete project tasks and produce deliverables
Requirements:
Degree in Mechanical Engineering
Minimum 2 years of project management experience
Good knowledge of Microsoft Office including Microsoft Project, Visio, AutoCAD or similar
Relevant knowledge in project risk assessment
Structure and systematic individual with strong analytical skills
A good communicator with effective stakeholder management & conflict resolution skills
Good time management skills and the ability to juggle multiple tasks at once
Organised with capacity to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Collaborative mindset to deliver stakeholders satisfaction

title: AVP IT Business Analyst / IT Technology Project Manager- Digital Banking / Mobile Banking / Online Banking
company_info: Stellar Link Partners is a boutique search firm with an initial focus on IT, HR, Legal and assisting China-owned companies to start up/hire in Singapore. The founding partners have a combination of more than 30 years of search/recruitment experience. Stellar Link was borne out of our passion in what we do and the desire to create a place where like-minded people can come together to practice at the highest professional standards. At Stellar Link, we believe the potential for greatness lies in all our us and we enjoy linking great talents to great opportunities. Let us help you uncover your next talent. You can find out more about us at https://stellar-link.com/ Stellar Link is part of the CGP Group of Companies.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our Client, Singapore's largest finance company is in the midst of expanding their IT Team. This is a great opportunity to join a growing technology team IT. You will be a part of a team to contribute in digital banking projects for the organisation

Role

We are looking for a highly motivated and experienced Digital Banking Project Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of successfully managing complex projects from start to finish. You will be responsible for the overall coordination, status reporting, and stability of project-oriented work efforts. You will also be responsible for assembling project plans and teamwork assignments, directing and monitoring work efforts on a daily basis, tracking key project milestones, and adjusting project plans to meet the needs of customers.


Responsibilities
Manage Digital banking projects, including overall project coordination, deliverables, tracking, and status reporting.
Resolve project issues as necessary with vendors or internal stakeholders.
Manage end-to-end project development life cycle.
Ensure the delivery of change management as part of the project implementation.
Manage backlog, create user stories, execute taskforce, and prioritize project activities.
Deploy user experience based on best practices without compromising the security.
Work with vendor to plan, develop, and implement business requirements, FSD, UAT, training, rollout, and ongoing testing.
Collect test data to identify defects and lead the enhancement process to sign off.
Recommend and implement adequate solutions to resolve issues based on best practices.
Work with cross-functional teams to ideate and create superior digital customer journey.
Engage and communicate with stakeholders to drive development, mitigate risks, and all digital banking associated matters.
Manage project budget, vendor, subcontractor, and relevant resources for the projects.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in relevant fields.
4-7 years of IT work experience, including 4 or more years managing projects.
Experience with projects in multiple technology domains and functions, primarily in the area of digital channels (web and/or app).
Understanding of the complexities and challenges underlying digital technology projects and business implications.
Project manager training and certification desirable, but not mandatory.
4+ years experience managing digital channels (online banking, mobile banking) projects. Preferred if brings experience on large transformation programs

APPLY NOW! Interviews are ongoing! Email to dayna.chiam@stellar-link.com
We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates would be notified.
Chiam Lee Ping Dayna
Consultant
Reg. No: R1764404
Stellar- Link Partners Pte Ltd (EA License: 21S0698)

title: PROJECT COORDINATOR
company_info: Greyform Pte Ltd, a member of Straits Construction Group, is incorporated in December 2015 to offer Precast and Prefabricated solutions to the construction industry. Operating from Greyform Building, the business focusses on providing building solutions that enable productivity improvement together with enhancement to quality and safety aspect of the construction industry. We capitalize on digital technology and automation for long term competitiveness, and aims to transform the traditional industry by injecting youth and new skills for the future economy.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview

As a Project Coordinator, you would work closely with clients to schedule, plan, monitor, forecast, resource and manage all the project activities aiming at assuring project accuracy and quality from conception to completion. You will be involved in getting shop-drawings approved and proposed rectifications on any defects found. You will ensure that the documentation system is always up to date and in line with ISO guidelines and customers expectation.

Responsibilities

1) Work closely between Singapore and Malaysia Plant to ensure smooth delivery of materials and precast components at sites.

2) Work closely with cross department team to ensure information and issues are clearly defined and resolved.

3) Monitor compliance to applicable codes, practices, QA/QC policies, performance standards and specifications.

4) Attend site meetings, feedback on sites progress and schedules, justify defects components and arrange for rectification, pre-delivery and post-delivery activities, etc.

5) Interact daily with the clients to interpret their needs and requirements and represent them in the field.

6) Perform overall quality control of the work (budget, schedule, plans, personnel’s performance) and report regularly on project status.

7) Plan, manage and coordinate projects to ensure that the projects are completed on time, within budget and of highest quality.

8) Liaise with the client, consultant, vendors, subcontractors and other relevant parties on field / factory inspection issues pertaining to the quality and project issues.

9) Cooperate and communicate effectively with project manager and other project participants to provide assistances and technical support.

10) Attend required interdepartmental meetings including providing relevant updates on the status of project and QC matters and to obtain and relay information which may impact the project pipeline.

11) Perform any other duties as assigned by the Management and the designated manager.

Requirements

1) Minimum Degree in Civil / Building / Construction or equivalent.

2) Minimum 1 year of relevant work experience in a Precast or Building & Construction environment with at least 1 year of supervisory capacity.

3) Knowledge of HDB precast construction practices and erection sequence.

4) Knowledge of relevant Statutory requirements and compliances.

5) Familiarity with rules, regulations, best practices and performance standards.

6) Good interpersonal skills to communicate with people of all levels.

7) Willing to work on Sundays or Public Holidays if required.

8) Proficient in Microsoft Office.

9) Someone with a Class 3 Driving License will be advantage.

Title: Project Manager
Employment type: Full-Time, Permanent
Working Hours: Monday - Friday Office Hours

Job Description:

Project Planning and Execution
Develop comprehensive project plans, including timelines, resource allocation, and critical milestones for A&A works in hospital infrastructure projects.
Coordinate and oversee all project activities, ensuring adherence to quality standards, regulatory requirements, and safety protocols.
Collaborate with various stakeholders, including engineers and contractors to ensure smooth project execution and resolve any challenges that may arise during construction.
Budget Management and Cost Control
Prepare and manage project budgets, forecasting costs accurately and maintaining financial control throughout the project lifecycle.
Evaluate cost estimates and quotations from contractors and suppliers, negotiating contracts to secure the most cost-effective solutions without compromising on quality or safety.
Review tender documents, vendor documetns and quotations
Risk Assessment and Mitigation
Conduct thorough risk assessments
Develop and implement risk mitigation strategies to proactively address challenges and minimize disruptions to project timelines and budgets.
Ensure compliance with relevant safety regulations and best practices, promoting a culture of safety among project team members and contractors.
Stakeholder Communication and Reporting
Facilitate effective communication with all project stakeholders
Provide regular progress updates and detailed reports on project status, highlighting key achievements, milestones, risks, and any deviations from the initial plan.
Act as the primary point of contact for any queries or concerns
Project Handover
Conduct thorough inspections and testing to verify the performance and functionality systems, making necessary adjustments or corrections as required.
Oversee the smooth handover of completed projects to end client, ensuring that all necessary documentation, training, and maintenance procedures are in place
Requirements
At least 3-5 years of project engineering / management experience
Well-versed in facilities management; ACMV / A&A works

title: Junior Project Manager (CQV)
company_info: PHARMENG TECHNOLOGY PTE. LTD. PharmEng Technology is a fully integrated multinational consultiany serving the pharmaceutical and life science industries. Our GMP compliance services include commissioning and qualification, validation, quality systems, engineering, auditing, process development, technology transfer, and professional training. We specialize in compliance to US FDA, EU GMP, Health Canada, PIC/S GMP, and WHO GMP regulations. Our regulatory services include pre- and post-market marketing authorization, license holding, maintenance, reporting, compliance, and adverse event handling in East and Southeast Asia. PharmEng currently operates permanently in US, Canada, Singapore, Taiwan, and Malaysia, plus projects around the world.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Commissioning / Qualification and Verification (CQV) Engineer (Singapore)

PharmEng Technology has been providing quality services to leading manufacturers of healthcare and pharmaceutical products since 1997. Our specialists hold expertise in Commissioning & Qualification, Validation, Quality Systems, Regulatory Affairs, Engineering, and Training to ensure that our clients can keep on providing the world with their cost-effective and high-standard healthcare products.

At PharmEng Technology, we strive to cultivate the best working environment where empowerment, passion and perseverance are nurtured while serving our clients to achieve their unique business goals. We are seeking an experienced Commissioning / Qualification and Verification (CQV) Engineer with solid experience in pharmaceutical engineering, equipment qualification and pharmaceutical solutions in the Life Science industries for a role in Singapore.

Objectives of this Role:
CQV Support: Assist in the planning, coordination, and execution of Commissioning, Qualification, and Validation activities for engineering projects related to mechanical and chemical systems.
Project Coordination: Collaborate with project stakeholders, engineering teams, vendors, and clients to ensure smooth project execution and timely completion of CQV tasks.
Documentation: Generate, review, and maintain necessary project documentation, including CQV protocols, test plans, reports, and validation documents, adhering to industry standards and regulations.
Compliance: Ensure that all CQV activities align with relevant regulatory requirements, quality standards, and company policies.
Risk Management: Identify and assess potential risks associated with CQV processes and propose mitigation strategies to the Project Manager and other stakeholders.
Budget and Schedule: Assist in monitoring project budgets and timelines, reporting any deviations, and suggesting corrective actions as needed.
Project Meetings: Participate in project meetings and provide updates on CQV progress, challenges, and achievements.
Admin Support: Handle administrative tasks, such as maintaining project files, organizing documentation, and managing project-related communications.

Skills and Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, or a related field.
Proven experience in Commissioning, Qualification, and Validation processes within the mechanical/chemical engineering domain.
1-3 years of relevant work experience in project management or engineering roles, preferably in the pharmaceutical, biotechnology, or similar industries.
Familiarity with industry standards and regulatory requirements related to CQV, such as cGMP, FDA, EMA, or other relevant guidelines.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively interact with diverse teams and stakeholders.
Proficient in using project management tools and software.
Self-motivated, adaptable, and able to work independently as well as part of a team.
Must be bilingual in English & Chinese

Why PharmEng Technology?
Our consultants come from different areas of the Pharmaceutical/Biotech/Medical Device industries and have extensive experiences obtained from world-class organizations in North America, Europe, and Asia. At PharmEng Technology, we value everyone’s unique talents and work together to support our clients. We offer continuous career growth, competitive wages, opportunities for travel and a team mentality that sets us apart from our competitors. It is the growth of our staff that continues to grow our company globally.

EEOC Statement
At PharmEng Technology, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our clients, and our community. PharmEng Technology is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

title: PROJECT MANAGER
company_info: Geo Lab (S) Pte Ltd is a local established laboratory which provides soil and rock testing services.
address: BARTLEY BIZ CENTRE, 15 KAKI BUKIT ROAD 4 417808
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Element has an opportunity for Project Manager for Singapore

In this role, you will be primarily responsible for assisting in designing, planning, and coordinating geotechnical instrumentation projects, scheduling control, obtaining permits for on-site installation, and setting up and commissioning monitoring

This will be a site based position in Singapore

Core Responsibilities
Involve in project coordination for Soil Investigation and installation of Geotechnical instrument installation works, supervise the recording of log soil and rock information during borehole drilling, collection of soil and rock samples according to sampling schedule for laboratory testing
Conduct in-situ testes (PMT, VST, PBT, PKT etc) according to testing schedule, risk analysis of jobs involved and ensure compliance to safe work procedures
Ensure day-to-day site operations are carried out as per project and safety requirements and attend project meetings, prepare project planning and coordination, supervision of Soil Investigation, reporting and other related scope of works
Responsible for all the implementation and completion towards management target, client’s expectation and compliance to authorities’ regulation
Other ad-hoc duties as assigne
Skills / Qualifications
Degree in civil engineering or geology, certificate in Site Investigation for Supervisors (BCA) is an advantage with 5 years’ relevant experience in major infrastructure projects,
Working experience in construction industry
Physically fit and able to withstand the challenging working conditions
Strong and determined quality focus with indefatigable determination to get the job done under the most challenging conditions and meet tight deadlines with minimum supervision
Self-motivated team player with excellent organisational and communication skills

title: Assistant Project Manager
company_info: MattenPlant Pte Ltd, a German - Singapore water technology & solutions company, with global operations and headquartered in Singapore. The company supplies modular, membraned-based systems and engineering solutions focusing on ultrafiltration, reverse osmosis and ion-exchange to industrial applications such as food and beverage, oil and gas, mining, powerplant, aquaculture, textile and other industries. As well as disinfection capability in Ozone, AOP (Advance Oxidation Process) and UV (Ultraviolet Light).
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Responsibilities:
Manage in-house and external personnel (e.g. sub-vendors, sub-contractors etc) for the implementation of engineering execution of water-and-wastewater related projects and/or the production of water/wastewater treatment systems.
Planning, scheduling, accomplishing, and coordinating the management of the project.
Prepare monthly project progress report, monthly cash flow reports and update project schedule for submission.
Prepare all project document under the contract scope.
Liaising, negotiating and managing sub-suppliers/sub-contractors in the region with respect to procurements and in-situ execution of sales contracts or projects.
Coordinating and communicating with end-user customers, in-house process design and production teams as well as local and regional suppliers for the production of deliverables as per contractual specifications and schedules.
Determining procurement plan and issue of purchase requisition to ensure materials are purchased timely as plan.
Projecting and monitoring cash flow requirements for procurement and installation process for the execution of any projects assigned.
Review Vendor’s datasheet, engineering drawings before submission to customer.
Review Commented documents returned from Customer and co-ordinate re-submission within period given.
Compiling process designs, technical specifications and drawings etc required for technical reviews and approvals of our end-user customers upon receipt of sales contracts.
Corresponding regularly with our end-user customers to update our production status, discussing, and determining changes in designs or specifications. Determining and spearheading shipment scheduling and logistic requirements, in-situ testing and commissioning scheduling and arrangements, post-sale trouble-shooting process and technical support etc.
Participation in meeting with client, sub-contractors, solving technical & management issues/problems arises during course of project execution.
Travelling to site for the supervision of all activities of installation and commissioning.
Prepare method statement and Risk Assessment for customer approval.
Accountable for the successful completion of the project within contract period and budget.
Work closely with QC department to ensure quality of products supplied by vendors and ensure client satisfaction.
Compiling and handover operation & maintenance (O&M) manuals to end-user customers.
Ad-hoc duties as assigned.
Job Requirements:
Diploma/Degree in Environmental, Industrial, Mechanical, Electrical or Chemical Engineering.
Good interpersonal relationship and communication skills with proficiency in spoken and written English.
Minimum 5 years of experiences in water treatment related industrial or engineering project coordination/management would be advantageous.
Able to travel locally or to regional countries (if needed) for site installation supervision, troubleshooting or testing and commissioning duties at clients' project sites.
Experience in commissioning of UF, RO, Demin system preferred.
Senior position will be considered for candidates with more relevant experience.
Candidate with short notice or immediate starter would be advantageous.

** Please indicate your expected salary in your resume.

title: Customer Service Project Coordinator
company_info: Established in 2001, Equiptest (The Company) is a highly Integrated Solution Provider of Precision Machines Components and Assemblies with Strategic manufacturing location in Singapore. The Company serves diverse market sectors in Semiconductor. The Company specializes in the mechanical engineering of new products, precision mechanisms, and automated process machinery. The development team has the extensive expertise in product development, herein, exacting client's specifications from conceptual design and product engineering through release to manufacturing.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
We are looking for Customer Service Project Coordinator to support Project Manager and teams by coordinating various activities, tasks and resources to achieve project goals within specified timelines and budgets.

Responsibilities
To collaborate with Project Manager to develop detailed project plans, including timelines, milestones, tasks and resource requirements.
To allocate tasks, track progress and ensure project activities are on schedule and address any delays or obstacles that may arise during project execution.
Facilitate communication among project team members, stakeholders and other relevant parties to ensure all team members are informed about project objectives, requirements and updates.
To maintain accurate project documentation including meeting minutes, progress reports and files and ensure all documentation is organized and easily accessible.
To monitor project deliverables to ensure they meet quality standards and adhere to project requirements.
To schedule and coordinate project meetings, including preparing agendas, facilitating discussions and documenting meeting outcomes.
Identify areas for process improvement within project management processes and suggest solutions for enhanced efficiency and effectiveness.
To prepare regular project status report for Project Manager, stakeholders by highlighting the progress, challenges and key milestones.
All other ad-hoc task assigned from time to time.
Requirements
Degree in Business Administration, Management or equivalent.
Minimum 3 - 5 years of relevant working experience in project coordination.
Proficient in MS Office application.
Possess organizational skills and attention to detail.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to think creatively.
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Strong multitasking skills and ability to prioritize tasks with strong time management skills.
Knowledge of project management methodologies and best practices.
Job Highlights
Monday – Friday: 8.30am to 5.30pm
Walking distance from Ubi MRT station
Team-focused work culture and environment

title: MCF - SAP Project Coordinator
company_info: ABEAM CONSULTING (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD. ABeam Consulting is a global management consulting firm with headquarters in Japan and with more than 4400 professionals in more than 11 countries and serve over 700 clients throughout Asia, the Americas, and Europe, providing business performance consulting services, integrating business strategy, business process design, information technology enablement, outsourcing and organizational performance and program / project management solutions to our clients. ABeam retains a powerful base of professional talent coupled with a global reach which we are recruiting top notch resources for. We currently have the following permanent positions:
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Us
Abeam Consulting is a global professional services company that specializes in delivering business transformation and technology solutions to clients across a wide range of industries. With a global presence and over 7500 employees worldwide we aim to be the transformation partner of choice for all of our clients.
About the Team
The Enterprise Transformation (EX) team is the current SAP Partner of the Year for Singapore and also SAP’s Regional Strategic Partner. The EX team is continuously looking to build its capabilities and competencies in line with SAP’s regional strategy and in working with our clients both old and new on their transformation journey.
Responsibilities:
Work closely with BU leader, Service Delivery Managers (SDM) and all Project Managers within the business unit.
Perform administrative support to coordinate with technical team(s), typically under the direction of the BU leader / SDM/ PM / Team Leaders.
Facilitate SAP project and AMS accounts: scheduling meeting and locations, taking meeting minutes, developing presentations, arranging training for project staff and etc.
Monitor overall AMS ticket issue and Change Request status and assign ticket to respective consultant promptly when received new ticket raised by client.
Prepare external Service/Utilization Reports for SDM to review and client submission in weekly/monthly basis.
Prepare the Fortnightly Management Report and share with BU Lead/Manager in bi-weekly basis.
Maintain Master Contract Tracker, monitor and track all the AMS contract expiry and initiate SDM to work with Sales Account Manager/Client for contract renewal. Initiate and follow through invoicing process up to receipt of payment.
Primary point of contact of AMS Ticketing Tool, provide administrative support such as account set up, updating user guide and provide system training to new customer and new onboard internal team member.
Track and maintain record of projects, assignees, contracts, sub-contracts, statuses, invoicing, renewals, extensions, and the like.
Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation, plans and reports.
Use tools to monitor working hours, plans and expenditures
Assist in resource planning and utilization monitoring, tracking and analysis.
Issue all appropriate legal paperwork (e.g., contracts and terms of agreement)
Drive software licensing procurement from RFQ, purchase, receipt, issue and record.
Track expiry and drive renewal of software licenses resold, notifying, and securing renewal confirmation and procurement thereof.
Provide administrative and coordination support and such other duties as directed.
Requirements:
Must have 4-7 years of administrative experience with at least 4 years of IT related project administration including reporting in MS excel working experience and PowerPoint working experience.
Supported multiple IT project activities like for e.g., reports, contract, ticket issue, project billing, project activities and deliverable tracking and etc.
Systematic and organized with strong sense of responsibility and urgency.
Able to prepare and interpret flowcharts, schedules and step-by-step action plans.
Knowledgeable and experienced in Microsoft Office applications, especially in MS Excel, pivot tables, analyses, v-lookup, MS Project, MS PowerPoint, etc.
Experience and comfortable with contracts, finance and accounting related activities.
Able to assign tasks with delegated authority and assist with schedule management.
Familiarity with risk management and quality assurance control.
Able to act as single point of contact of information and coordination.
Confident to work with the Director and Managers to remove blockers.
Create logical and meaningful repository and filing system for maintaining project documentation, plans and reports and the like.
Why Join Us
At Abeam Consulting, we place a strong emphasis on collaboration, and helping our employees grow and develop their skills, offering a supportive and empowering work environment. With a presence in multiple countries and a diverse range of clients, Abeam Consulting offers an exciting and dynamic workplace for individuals looking to build a career in consulting. Abeam Consulting has also recently joined SAP’s regional strategic partner initiative as their first regional partner in the region and has also been recognized by UiPath as a Diamond Partner in providing RPA solutions. With such accolades, we aim to continue driving enterprise and digital transformation initiatives in order to transform the way people work and communicate in the digital age. In addition, our industry team is working tirelessly in order to bring more solutions to the banking and finance sector.

title: Project Manager
company_info: Axisoft is a Top-Notch Financial Technology Provider with offices in Singapore, Hong Kong and China. In addition, we have been providing professional services of core banking systems to top-tier private banks in Asia. Following are the awards and certificates we received. • Hong Kong ICT Best FinTech Award • Hong Kong ICT Best Innovation & Research Award • Asian Private Banker - Most Innovative Solution for the Technology Award • Asian Private Banker - Top Private Banking Technology Providers in Asia • China National Hi-Tech Enterprise • CMMI Level 3 Certificate If you are a talented professional and desire the excitement of creating Financial Technology, software and solutions that will affect millions seriously, consider Axisoft as we are a place to make a difference. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:

- Help the financial sector in the region to implement mission-critical solutions with state-of-the-art technology.

- Manage key and mission-critical projects in the FinTech realm for the regional banking and financial institutions, ensure projects are completed on schedule while with satisfactory quality and within budget.

- Participate in the project pre-sales stage for the assessment of the project scope, schedule, effort, resources, activities and risk.

- Manage the ongoing support and maintenance of the banking solutions in the post-implementation stage.

- Coordinate with different stakeholders, such as clients, business teams, project teams and management to facilitate successful negotiation at work and critical issue escalation.

- Manage project finance, risk, scope, resource, activities, progress and deliverables for the successful end-to-end implementation of the mission-critical financial system.

- Prepare project management materials, such as project plan, progress updates, presentation and meeting minutes.

- Manage the quality of the project documents, such as solution and requirements specifications, technical specifications, test and implementation plan, etc.

- Establish standards and operation procedures for project deliverables and services.



Requirements:

- Bachelor’s Degree (or higher) in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering or related field.

- Good understanding of FinTech and the applications of state-of-the-art technology.

- At least 5 years of working experience in project management, preferably in the banking and financial sector, less experienced candidates can be considered as project coordinators.

- Excellent consulting and communication skills, ability to articulate, drive discussion across business functions and stakeholders and reach conclusions and action items efficiently.

- Possess in-depth knowledge of the latest technologies, such as API, Big Data, Cloud Computing.

- Possess good knowledge of the business domain of banking, finance and wealth management.

- Excellent client and team management skills.



We offer competitive remuneration, comprehensive fringe benefits, international exposure, promising career prospect and opportunities to work in global top-tier financial institutions. Interested parties, please submit your CV to hr@axisoft.com.



Salary and Benefits:

- Competitive salary package and performance bonuses

- Medical insurance

- Telecommunications allowance

- Annual Leave, Marriage Leave, Childcare Leave, Compassionate Leave, etc.



Learning and Development:

- Building up the knowledge in FinTech and banking operations

- Training in financial technology (FinTech), consulting, business analysis and project management

- Diverse career progression opportunities from subject matter expert, products, solutions and business analyst, technology lead and management



Work Arrangement:

- Remote work with an ultra-flexible working culture

- Good work-life balance

- Regular company social gathering



Dress Code:

- Formal with clients

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
My Client are seeking a skilled and experienced Web3 GameFi Project Manager to oversee the development and execution of our Web3 GameFi projects. As a Project Manager, you will be responsible for managing the end-to-end lifecycle of game development, integrating Web3 and decentralised finance (DeFi) concepts. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including game designers, developers, blockchain engineers, and artists, to ensure successful delivery of innovative and engaging GameFi experiences.

Responsibilities:
Lead and manage the overall planning, execution, and delivery of Web3 GameFi projects, ensuring they are completed within scope, budget, and timeline.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define project objectives, requirements, and success criteria.
Develop comprehensive project plans, including tasks, milestones, resource allocation, and dependencies, and effectively communicate them to the project team.
Coordinate and prioritise tasks across cross-functional teams, ensuring efficient workflow and effective communication.
Monitor project progress, identify risks, and implement mitigation strategies to address any issues that may arise.
Foster a collaborative and positive team environment, promoting open communication, knowledge sharing, and continuous improvement.
Manage project budgets, track expenses, and ensure adherence to financial targets.
Collaborate closely with game designers, developers, and blockchain engineers to ensure the successful integration of Web3 and DeFi concepts into GameFi projects.
Coordinate with external partners and vendors, as necessary, to ensure smooth project execution.
Stay up to date with industry trends, advancements in Web3 technologies, and GameFi best practices, and apply relevant knowledge to project management strategies.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Project Management, Game Development, Computer Science, or a related field. Master's degree is a plus.
Proven experience as a Project Manager, preferably in the gaming industry or Web3/GameFi projects.
Strong understanding of Web3 technologies, blockchain, and decentralised finance (DeFi) concepts.
Experience managing end-to-end game development projects, including planning, execution, and delivery.
Familiarity with game development processes, including game design, programming, and art production.
Excellent organisational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritise tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire cross-functional teams.
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with diverse stakeholders.
Proactive problem-solving and risk management abilities, with a focus on delivering high-quality projects on time and within budget.
Familiarity with project management tools and methodologies, such as Agile or Scrum.
If you are shortlisted for the first round of screening, our Recruiter will contact you directly.
EA License No: 21C0571 | EA Reg No:21103634 (Johnny Wu)

company_info: Stellar Link Partners is a boutique search firm with an initial focus on IT, HR, Legal and assisting China-owned companies to start up/hire in Singapore. Stellar Link was borne out of our passion in what we do and the desire to create a place where like-minded people can come together to practice at the highest professional standards. At Stellar Link, we believe the potential for greatness lies in all our us and we enjoy linking great talents to great opportunities. Let us help you uncover your next talent. You can find out more about us at https://stellar-link.com/ Stellar Link is part of the CGP Group of Companies.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our Client, Singapore's largest finance company is in the midst of expanding their IT Team. This is a great opportunity to join a growing technology team IT. You will be a part of a team to contribute in digital banking projects for the organisation

Role

We are looking for a highly motivated and experienced Digital Banking Project Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of successfully managing complex projects from start to finish. You will be responsible for the overall coordination, status reporting, and stability of project-oriented work efforts. You will also be responsible for assembling project plans and teamwork assignments, directing and monitoring work efforts on a daily basis, tracking key project milestones, and adjusting project plans to meet the needs of customers.


Responsibilities
Manage Digital banking projects, including overall project coordination, deliverables, tracking, and status reporting.
Resolve project issues as necessary with vendors or internal stakeholders.
Manage end-to-end project development life cycle.
Ensure the delivery of change management as part of the project implementation.
Manage backlog, create user stories, execute taskforce, and prioritize project activities.
Deploy user experience based on best practices without compromising the security.
Work with vendor to plan, develop, and implement business requirements, FSD, UAT, training, rollout, and ongoing testing.
Collect test data to identify defects and lead the enhancement process to sign off.
Recommend and implement adequate solutions to resolve issues based on best practices.
Work with cross-functional teams to ideate and create superior digital customer journey.
Engage and communicate with stakeholders to drive development, mitigate risks, and all digital banking associated matters.
Manage project budget, vendor, subcontractor, and relevant resources for the projects.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in relevant fields.
4-7 years of IT work experience, including 4 or more years managing projects.
Experience with projects in multiple technology domains and functions, primarily in the area of digital channels (web and/or app).
Understanding of the complexities and challenges underlying digital technology projects and business implications.
Project manager training and certification desirable, but not mandatory.
4+ years experience managing digital channels (online banking, mobile banking) projects. Preferred if brings experience on large transformation programs

APPLY NOW! Interviews are ongoing! Email to dayna.chiam@stellar-link.com
We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates would be notified.
Chiam Lee Ping Dayna
Consultant
Reg. No: R1764404
Stellar- Link Partners Pte Ltd (EA License: 21S0698)
