address: TANGLIN HALT INDUSTRIAL ESTATE, 115A COMMONWEALTH DRIVE 149596
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Company background:
Focus Computer Pte Ltd has been operating since 1989, and is an established leader in the IT hardware and software fulfilment space in Singapore. We have provided a stable environment for our employees since our inception and we believe in taking care of our employees through thick and thin. We have established Focus Digitech Pte Ltd In order to meet the growing demands for digital transformation by our customers, and we have an opportunity to hire Project Managers to join our growing team. Your entry point into the company does not limit the potential you have to rise within the company to other roles as your aspirations and attitudes may propel you towards. We believe that paper qualifications can only tell us so much, and we believe in hiring people with the right skills and not just certifications (although we will accord due credit if you have them). So, come on and discover your full potential with us as we take Focus Digitech to the next level of leadership in digital technologies!
About the Role
You will be working closely with our project management team and technology experts in a high-performance environment. You will be working to help our customers with their digital transformation journey by taking out the complexities of technology deployment while allowing customers to focus on their business transformation. You will have the opportunity to rapidly deepen your skills on the projects and working with high-performance teammates. You may also have the exciting opportunity to work across multiple industries and use cases, and potentially grow your career further with us!
As a Project Coordinator, you will contribute to ensuring customer projects are delivered on time, on budget and to achieve a high customer satisfaction score. You will achieve this by working with our project management, sales and solutions teams to understand the scope of the projects and managing the projects to the agreed deliverables.
You will have the opportunity to influence customers to re-engage the company for additional projects or change requests and will be financially compensated for such.
Role and Responsibilities
The candidate is expected to perform the following duties:
· Project coordination of multiple client projects.
· Lead the planning and implementation of project base on project tasks and requirements.
· Coordinate and manage project resource assignments to projects.
· Develop project plans, such as Gantt charts, deliverables trackers, etc., using appropriate tools.
· Monitor and report on progress of projects to stakeholders, maintaining minutes of meetings, issues/risks registers, and relevant project management documentation.
· Liaise with development teams (local or offshore) to track the deliverables against SOWs.
· Develop and implement change controls for projects where necessary.
· Project evaluations and assessment of results
· Preparing the project plans and monitoring the project to successful closure.
· Maintain accurate and timely project delivery forecast.
· Acquire new business and/or change requests in client projects assigned to.
· Drive superior customer experience by working with teammates and partners to deliver solutions that exceed customers’ expectations.
· Drive and achieve Customer Net Promoter Score of 4.0 and above.
· Support sales and solutions teams in bid management activities.
· Contribute to and participate in processes, programs and initiatives that are intended to increase productivity and innovation.
· Establish himself/herself as a “Trusted Advisor” to the prospect or customer.
· Collaborate and maintain strong relationships with technology vendor partners as required.
Experience and Personality Ideals
· 1+ years of experience in IT project coordination or management experience.
· Familiar with Office productivity tools for Scope of Work document writing, tender submissions and customer presentations.
· Have a passion for customers to be successful.
· Excellent customer problem management and problem-solving skills.
· Strong communication skills and the ability to establish and maintain strong customer relationships through effective interpersonal skills.
· Results oriented, great in collaboration and a self-starter who is highly motivated to support others to succeed
· Good objection handling and negotiating ability.
· Able to multi-task and manage multiple streams of work and opportunities simultaneously.
· Resourceful and able to manage own workload with minimal supervision.
Qualifications and Education Requirements
· Diploma in Infocomm Technology or Project Management would be advantageous.
· PMP or CITPM certification would be advantageous.
· Fluent in English, written and spoken.
· Fresh graduates are welcome to apply.

Contact Information:
Email: jobs@focus.sg

job_category: Building and Construction, Consulting, Information Technology, Professional Services
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Role: IT Project Manager
Location: Singapore
About PTS Singapore
PTS Consulting Singapore Pte. Ltd. (PTS) has been driving technology innovation as an experience-led technology design consultancy since 2004.
Our expertise spans multiple disciplines, allowing us to take a holistic view of technology and effectively articulate and realise the technology vision of our clients.
We bring fresh ideas to every engagement, champion bold ideas, independent thinking and co-innovate with our trusted partners to deliver engaging digital experiences underpinned by data and technology.
With this balance, we are able to expertly execute our designs and seamlessly integrate different technologies to create well-optimised spaces that delight.
We are PTS and we strategise and sit at the convergence of People, Technology and Space.
To find out more about our company, our values and what we stand for, visit https://www.pts.com.sg/aboutus and https://www.pts.com.sg/join-pts
Role: Overview
We are seeking a dynamic and seasoned IT Project Manager to become a vital part of our team. The ideal candidate should demonstrate a proven track record of successfully managing complex commercial projects from start to completion.
In this role, you will plan, direct, and coordinate activities of IT infrastructure projects to ensure that goals or objectives of the project are accomplished on time and in accordance with the business requirements. Your duties will encompass devising project plan, distributing team responsibilities, monitoring and controlling project execution, and adapting strategies to align with business requirements.
Responsibilities
- Manage technology infrastructure implementation in commercial office fit out / relocation / expansion projects, overseeing Network, Telecommunication Circuits, Audio & Visual System, Structured Cabling, Server Room and end user equipment aspects of the projects.
- Work closely with internal and external business stakeholders to understand and analyze business requirements.
- Translate business IT requirements to technical requirements and propose full-scale infrastructure project proposal with the technical team.
- Responsible for project planning, execution, monitoring and controlling.
- Work with cross-functional teams to plan and develop project timeline and budget.
- Accountable for progress tracking and status reporting to the business team.
- Negotiate and resolve project issues with internal or external team.
- Identify potential risks and develop strategies to mitigate or manage them. Regularly assess and update the risk management plan as the project progresses.
- Handle changes to the project scope, objectives, or requirements. Assess the impact of changes and communicate them to relevant stakeholders.
- Keep accurate and up-to-date documentation of project plans, progress, decisions, and outcomes. This documentation can serve as a reference for future projects and audits.
- Ensure that all project objectives have been met and that deliverables are complete within timeline and budget. Conduct a post-project review to analyze successes, areas for improvement, and lessons learned.
Requirements
- Bachelor’s Degree of technology discipline, or background in technology environment delivering solutions or projects.
- Minimum 5 years of IT work experience.
- Professional certificates such as PMP, RCDD, CCNP, CDCDP etc. will be preferred.
- Technical background in structured cabling, network infrastructure or data center design & build will be an advantage to the candidate.
- High quality and successful infrastructure project delivery experience, includes but not limited to structured cabling, network and system solutions related projects.
- Strong stakeholder management capabilities and strategic mindset to advise and manage internal and external vendors.
- Strong coordination and excellent project management skills
- Good sense of problem locating, priority, and time management
- Result oriented, with strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
- Excellent reporting and documentation skills to ensure timely, clear, and concise information flow among all stakeholders.
- Experience in remote project coordination and multiple regions IT service deployment
- Passionate in IT infrastructure domain
- Comfortable to work in a fast-paced environment and able to face urgent requests with clear mindset of processes.

title: Project Manager / Executive [Lighting / Sub-contractor] - 1222
company_info: Annexion strives to be a premier Built Environment global headhunting consultancy and plays a key role in connecting all stakeholders in the Built Environment sector. With an international focus in Property & Real Estate, Construction & Engineering, Interior Design & Architecture, and the Built Technology sector, Annexion seeks to make an impact in the industry through connecting every stakeholder, one at a time.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are currently representing a leading and dynamic commercial lighting distributor, specializing in providing innovative lighting solutions to a diverse range of industries. As we continue to expand our operations, we are seeking talented and motivated Project Manager and Project Executives to join our team and play a crucial role in driving project coordination and success. If you relish the opportunity to shape and lead impactful lighting projects within a dynamic industry and would like to work in a collaborative and supportive work environment that values innovation and excellence. This will be exciting for you. Furthermore, you will enjoy a competitive compensation package and benefits, and will enjoy professional growth and development opportunities.
Key Responsibilities:
Take ownership of project planning, execution, monitoring, and closure. Lead cross-functional teams to ensure alignment and effective communication throughout the project lifecycle.
Define project scope, objectives, and deliverables in collaboration with stakeholders. Continuously assess and manage scope changes, ensuring project goals remain intact.
Allocate resources efficiently to tasks, balancing workloads across the team and ensuring optimal utilization of available resources.
Develop and manage project schedules, identifying critical path activities and potential bottlenecks. Keep projects on track by monitoring progress and proactively addressing delays.
Manage project budgets, track expenses, and provide accurate and timely financial reports to senior management.
Identify potential project risks and develop mitigation strategies. Address issues as they arise and implement contingency plans to minimize disruptions.
Foster strong relationships with clients, vendors, and internal teams. Communicate project status, updates, and expectations to ensure alignment and satisfaction.
Maintain a sharp focus on quality by ensuring that project deliverables meet established standards and customer expectations.
Maintain accurate project documentation, including project plans, schedules, budgets, change orders, and relevant correspondence.
Proactively identify opportunities for process improvements and implement best practices to enhance project management efficiency.
Key Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Project Management, Business Administration, Engineering, or a related field.
Proven experience (3-5 years) in project management, preferably within the lighting industry or related fields. Lesser experience candidate will be consider executive role.
Proficiency in project management methodologies and tools.
Strong organizational skills with a keen attention to detail.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to facilitate collaboration and maintain effective relationships with stakeholders.
Problem-solving mindset with the ability to adapt to changing project requirements.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines and quality standards.
Proficiency in project management software and Microsoft Office Suite.
PMI or other relevant project management certification is a plus.
If you are a motivated Project Manager with a passion for delivering exceptional results in the commercial lighting distribution industry, we encourage you to apply and explore more now!

If you believe that you fit the requirements of this opportunity and this opportunity will contribute to your career aspirations, apply now or reach out to Daniel Lim at daniel.lim@annexion-partners.com. You may also contact Daniel at +65 6632 6679.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
d²x Expertise is a global IT service consulting organization dedicated to Project management, IT Services Management and Contracts Management operations.
We provide to our customers, CxOs (CIO, CTO, COO, CEO) of multinationals, or large international companies, a full range of services to secure their commitments.
We also perform recruitment missions for companies looking to hire IT profiles directly.
We are looking for an IT Project Coordinator to be part of the client’s Project Management Office team, collaborating with the APAC and French teams, vendors, partners and clients, coordinating the different parts of a project together.
The main responsibility of the Project Management Office team is to have a bird’s eye view of everything happening in a project to be able to assess, report, provide options and act in line with the project plan.
He/she will be assisting the regional project manager with the development & implementation of projects to support:
• in managing complex project or multiple-project deliverables across APAC.
• all aspects of the projects to ensure execution is aligned to the project’s goals.
• in the production of detailed project plans and maintain project documents and processes.
• the day-to-day project activities, resources and participate in meetings for minutes capture.
• in the project administrative tasks
Responsibilities
• Monitor, track and report the status of project deliverables to ensure that it is in line with the approved project plans.
• Manage project schedules and associated tasks such as booking of meetings and the resources required, taking meeting minutes and follow-up actions.
• Update and communicate regularly the project’s record of project plan, timesheets, backlogs, resource capacity and weekly status report.
• Contribute to the development of project plans, including research and analysis of options in relation to project deliverables and improvements.
• Facilitate daily team’s status meeting or Scrum, to keep the status up to date and escalate issues to project managers.
• Maintain register of project management documents and processes, and other relevant organizational policies for audit processes.
• Understand interdependencies between project streams, teams, as well as technology, operations and business.
• Monitor project scope and changes.
• Assist in monitoring the project’s quality control and participate in quality issue resolution.
Requirements
• Bachelor’s degree or Polytechnic Diploma in related fields including in management, business or administrative
• Proven 2-4 years of relevant experience in either management, business or technology domain
• Understanding of the System/Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)
• Excellent organizational, interpersonal and communication skills
• Knowledge in Agile methodology and Scrum would be advantageous
• Knowledge in MS Project, JIRA, MS Excel and MS PowerPoint presentation
What they offer
• Exposure to high profile, large scale strategic projects
• Excellent medical, dental and maternity coverage for you and your dependents
• Life insurance, allowances
• A co-working space filled with multinational companies / startups / entrepreneurs, located next to Raffles Place MRT
• An entrepreneurial, collaborative, and fun-loving office culture, within a dynamic team

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Oversee the procurement of necessary resources for assigned projects.
Apply contemporary practices in construction methodology to complete assigned works in compliance with client expectations, company objectives, and all contractual obligations.
Oversee construction planning, programming, and completion schedules.
Engagement of subcontractors, management of subcontractor's work to achieve outcomes, and all major subcontract variations.
Assist in the implementation, monitoring, and review of a construction management plan.
Monitor progress, ensure that work quality and techniques are of a high standard, and report regularly on project performance and cost against company objectives.
Ensure correct supervisory levels, construction costs, schedule, and change management.
Ensure that requirements and risk controls are considered in all construction planning and processes.
Ensure that stakeholders are actively engaged and that beneficial relationships between the project and the client, subcontractors, community, and other external parties are developed and maintained.
Perform all duties in accordance with CHEC policies, processes, systems, and procedures.
The Coordination Manager shall take charge of all coordination work of civil, structural, architectural and System-Wide Contractors (SWCs) and be responsible to manage project coordinators relating to civil /structural, architectural and E&M.
Requirements:
Minimum 8 years of engineering experience with a recognized Engineering Degree
At least 8 years experience in managing Civil, Architectural and/or E&M Building Services works of similar scale and complexity.
Experienced in BIM and managing interfaces for the design and construction of transit projects; having a full understanding of the design and approval process as well as the BCA TOP process.
Min 5-12 years of related experience on LTA - MRT or any Civil Infrastructure projects in Singapore
Relevant coordination experience with Government Agencies
For a confidential discussion please send your cv to sumitra@artemisessg.com
